portisculus: <entryFree id="n37146" type="main" key="portiscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portiscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n37146.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a truncheon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hammer</hi> with which the master of the rowers gave signals, and beat time to indicate the proper stroke: tonsas ante tenentes Parerent, observarent, portisculus signum Cum dare coepisset, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 26</bibl> (Ann. v. 233 Vahl.); Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234</bibl> Müll.: nec palmarum pulsus nec portisculi, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 28</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n37146.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad loquendum atque ad tacendum tu ut habes portisculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portito: <entryFree id="n37147" type="hapax" key="porti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>porto</etym>, <sense id="n37147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus crumenam portitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portitor: <entryFree id="n37148" type="main" key="porti^tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>portus</etym>, <sense id="n37148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tollgatherer</hi> (at a seaport), <hi rend="ital">a receiver</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collector of customs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a custom-house officer</hi> (syn. telonarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 7, 20</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 22</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">they forwarded letters: epistulam ... ad portitores esse delatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: portitorum simillimae sunt januae lenoniae; <cit><quote lang="la">Si adfers, tum patent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>.—On account of their strict examinations, transf., <hi rend="ital">a woman who pries into every thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37149" type="main" key="porti^tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from the root por, whence porto, a bearer, carrier</etym>. <sense id="n37149.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37149.1" n="A" level="2"> Usually one who conveys people in a boat or ship. </sense><sense id="n37149.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a ferryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boatman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mariner</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Plato cum flumen nave transisset, non ab illo quicquam portitor exegisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37149.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the ferryman</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Charon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi portitor aera recepit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">Orci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaei amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:559" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 559</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:784" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 784</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n37149.4" n="B" level="2"> By land, <hi rend="ital">a carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wagoner</hi>: Portitor Ursae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the constellation Bootes</hi>, who, as it were, drives the wain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:693" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 693</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37149.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi> (mostly post-class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bajulus): Helles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Ram</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:155" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 155</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:72:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 72, 7</bibl>, we read proditor Helles): <cit><quote lang="la">lecti sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 49, 17</bibl></cit>: frumenti, <pb n="1402" /> <cb n="PORT" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl>: ciborum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 405: <cit><quote lang="la">apicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portitorium: <entryFree id="n37150" type="gloss" key="porti^to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. portitor</etym>, <sense id="n37150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a toll-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom-house</hi>: portitorium, <foreign lang="greek">telwnei=on</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
portiuncula: <entryFree id="n37151" type="main" key="porti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>portio</etym>, <sense id="n37151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portion</hi> (post-Aug.). vestis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 3, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">pr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae Suetonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porto: <entryFree id="n37152" type="main" key="porto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">porto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>root porfor for-to, kindr. with fer-o; Sanscr. vhri, ferre</etym>, <sense id="n37152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry along; to convey</hi> any thing heavy (class.; syn.: fero, gero, veho). </sense><sense id="n37152.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri proprie dicimus, quae quis suo corpore bajulat, portari ea, quae quis in jumento secum ducit, agi ea, quae animalia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:235" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 235</bibl></cit> (the foll. pass. prove that this distinction is not valid): <cit><quote lang="la">ut id, quod agri efferant sui, quascumque velint in terras portare possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem ad Baias octophoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massili portabant juvenes ad litora tanas, Enn. ap. Don. p. 1777 P. (Ann. v. 605 Vahl.): frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viaticum ad hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilium in triumpho,</quote> <trans><tr>to conduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora insueta ad onera portanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub alā Fasciculum librorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in suo sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad modum aliquid portantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter qui te portavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum, hominis occidendi causā portare, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 1, 13, 1.—Esp. of ships, etc.: navis portat milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves onerariae commeatum ab Ostiā in Hispaniam ad exercitum portantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatum exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 23, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37152.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37152.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): onustum pectus porto laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui tantum boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">di boni, boni quid porto!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porto hoc jurgium Ad uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui aliquam fallaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timores insolitos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces alicujus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:326" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 326</bibl></cit>.—With abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid peccati portet haec purgatio,</quote> <trans><tr>bears with it</tr>, <tr>imports</tr>, <tr>betokens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portantia verba salutem,</quote> <trans><tr>bringing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam Tradam protervis in mare Portare ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:428" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 428</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">sociis atque amicis auxilia portabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias, decus, gloriam, libertatem atque patriam in dexteris portare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has spes cogitationesque secum portantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad conjuges liberosque laetum nuntium portabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vobis bellum et pacem portamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37152.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolores nostros ipse portavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 53, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 15, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portorium: <entryFree id="n37153" type="main" key="porto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portōrĭum</orth> (<sense id="n37153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> PORTORIEIS, Plebisc. Thermens ap. Orell. 3673), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root por, whence porto, portitor, portus, that belongs to carrying or conveying; hence</etym>, </sense><sense id="n37153.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impost</hi> paid on goods imported or exported: portorium dare, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 15</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego pol istum portitorem privabo portorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portorium circumvectionis,</quote> <trans><tr>a tax paid for the right of hawking goods about the country</tr>, <tr>a peddler's tax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n37153.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freight</hi>, = naulum: <cit><quote lang="la">Charon expetens portorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
portuensis: <entryFree id="n37154" type="main" key="Portu^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Portŭensis</orth> (also written PORTENSIS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 437, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1027, 4</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>portus</etym>, <sense id="n37154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the port of Ostia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Portuensian</hi>: mensores, <hi rend="ital">grain-measurers at the port of Ostia</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 4, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 462, 1</bibl>: horrea, <hi rend="ital">granaries at the port of Ostia</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 23, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">SVSCEPTORES,</quote> <trans><tr>collectors of port-duties</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FABER FERRARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 84</bibl></cit>, n. 144; cf. Nibby, Della via Portuense e dell' antica città di Porto, Rom. 1827.</sense></entryFree>
portula: <entryFree id="n37155" type="main" key="portu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>porta</etym>, <sense id="n37155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small door</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207, 2</bibl>. <cb n="PORU" /></sense></entryFree>
portulaca: <entryFree id="n37156" type="main" key="portu^la_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portŭlāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purslain</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
portunus: <entryFree id="n37157" type="main" key="Portu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Portūnus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Portum-nus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>portus</etym>, <sense id="n37157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the protecting god of harbors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Palaemon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:547" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 241</bibl> Serv.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1585</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37157.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Portūnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Portumn-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Portunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Portunal</hi>: flamen, Poët. ap. Fest. s. v. persillum, p. 217 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n37157.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Portūnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Portunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated annually on the</hi> 17<hi rend="ital">th of August</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 19</bibl> Müll.; Calend. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 396</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
portuose: <entryFree id="n37158" type="main" key="portu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. portuosus <sense id="n37158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
portuosus: <entryFree id="n37159" type="main" key="portu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>portus</etym>, <sense id="n37159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding in harbors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having many harbors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Trinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars Numidiae portuosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio minime portuosa,</quote> <trans><tr>with no ports to run into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">portŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with many harbors;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portuosius illic alveus Nili,</quote> <trans><tr>with more harbors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
portus: <entryFree id="n37160" type="main" key="portus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">portus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n37160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> porti, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 20</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> portibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 7</bibl> et saep.; a better form than portubus), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>por, whence porto, portitor</etym>.—Prop., <hi rend="ital">an entrance;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n37160.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A harbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">port</hi>: Lunai portus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 9</bibl> (Ann. v. 16 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">portus Caietae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31, 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Graeciae portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e portu solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail out of port</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">e portu proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex portu exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex portu naves educere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 22: portum linquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail into</tr>, <tr>to enter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter the port</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in portum ex alto invehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum deferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum se recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum navim cogere (al. conicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum penetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to reach a port</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum voluntatis deduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:106:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 106, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portu operam dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to be an officer of the customs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl>.—With reference to the import-duty to be paid in ports: <cit><quote lang="la">ex portu vectigal conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 171</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in portu navigare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be in safety</tr>, <tr>out of all danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in portu esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37160.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">the mouth of a river</hi>, where it empties into the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 13, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37160.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as also the Greek <foreign lang="greek">limh/n</foreign>, and our <hi rend="ital">haven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place of refuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an asylum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi> (class.; a favorite trope of Cicero): portus corporis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 415 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam portum aliquem exspecto illam solitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with tamquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in philosophiae portum conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum, populorum, nationum portus erat et refugium senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium non supplicium est, sed perfugium portusque supplicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 34, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic portus, haec arx, haec ara sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:48:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi parta quies, omnisque in limine portus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>security is at hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venias portus et ara tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos eritis nostrae portus et ara fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 8, 68</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37160.4" n="II" level="1"> In the oldest Latinity, <hi rend="ital">a house</hi> (as a place which one enters): <cit><quote lang="la">portum in XII. pro domo positum omnes fere consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n37160.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A warehouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus appellatus est conclusus locus, quo importantur merces et inde exportantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:59" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Licini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
porus: <entryFree id="n37161" type="greek" key="po^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n37161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel in the body</hi>: cordis sui, Ambros. Hexaëm. 3, 9, 39; of <hi rend="ital">the air passages</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 80</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pori meatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 228</bibl></cit> (al. permeatus).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37162" type="greek" key="po_rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pw=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n37162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tufa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 17, 28, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:53" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 6, 9, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37163" type="main" key="Po_rus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pw=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n37163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Honor. 375</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 258</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 446</bibl>. <cb n="POSC" /></sense></entryFree>
posca: <entryFree id="n37164" type="main" key="posca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">posca</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pusca</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 48</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. <foreign lang="greek">po/w</foreign>, poto</etym>, <sense id="n37164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an acidulous drink of vinegar and water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 12, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:56" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 5, 14, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 46" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 10</bibl>; cf.: posca, <foreign lang="greek">o)cu/kraton, po/sis</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37165" type="main" key="Posca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Posca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Pinarius Posca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poscaenium: <entryFree id="n37166" type="main" key="poscaenium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poscaenium</orth>, v. postscaenium.</entryFree>
poscinummius: <entryFree id="n37167" type="hapax" key="posci^nummius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poscĭnummius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nūmius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>posco-nummus</etym>, <sense id="n37167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">money-seeking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mercenary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
posco: <entryFree id="n37168" type="main" key="posco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">posco</orth>, <itype>pŏposci, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n37168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> peposci, Val. Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi> [for porc-scere; Sanscr. root parkh- prakh-, to ask; cf.: precor, procus, procax], <hi rend="ital">to ask for urgently; to beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi> (syn.: flagito, postulo, peto). </sense><sense id="n37168.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> (<hi rend="ital">sibi</hi>): <hi rend="ital">aliquid ab aliquo;</hi> also with a double <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or wholly <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscere est secundum Varronem, quotiens aliquid pro merito nostro deposcimus: petere vero est cum aliquid humiliter et cum precibus postulamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 194</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n37168.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posco atque adeo flagito crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>, § 44; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 34, § 78: pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: nec mi aurum posco, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 200 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid poscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vades poposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciae partes Roscii sibi poposcerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatis veniam poscentem (preceded by postulare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37168.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, ut audeat Tibi credere omnia, abs te petere et poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: diem a praetore peposcit, Val. Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 47, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutorem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere a me poscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joann. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37168.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes pretium pro sepulturā liberum poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum nummos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">44: aliquem causam disserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claves portarum magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita creditum Poscis Quintilium deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur me in decursu lampada poscis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:61" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscenti vos rationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 3, 15.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: poscor aliquid, <hi rend="ital">I am asked for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something is asked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demanded of me</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">gravidae posceris exta bovis,</quote> <trans><tr>they ask you for the entrails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:670" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 670</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poscor meum Laelapa,</quote> <trans><tr>they demand of me my Lœlaps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum segetes alimentaque debita dives Poscebatur humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod rationem pecuniae posceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 12</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to be called upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invoked</hi> to inspire a poet or to sing: <cit><quote lang="la">aversus Apollo Poscitur invitā verba pigenda lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 76 (better reading poscis ab); cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Palilia poscor: Non poscor frustra; <cit><quote lang="la">si favet alma Pales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:721" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 721</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">poscimur Aonides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37168.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscimus, ut cenes civiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:112" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscimus ut sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 39</bibl>: poposcit, ut haec ipsa quaestio diligentius tractaretur, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 21.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">poscat sibi fabula credit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 339</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immolare Fauno, Seu poscat agnā sive malit haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse sacerdotes delubraque vestra tueri Poscimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraque occurrere poscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:194" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:128" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 151</bibl>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero te etiam morari posco inter voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 254</bibl>. So, too, perh. (acc. to Stephanus's conjecture): <cit><quote lang="la">vos fallere poscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:Fig. 2:19, p. 181" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> Fig. 2, 19, p. 181</bibl></cit> Frotsch.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">poscunt majoribus poculis, sc. bibere,</quote> <trans><tr>they challenge to drink from larger goblets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be a beggar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbus es, cum poscis, ait. Sed pensio clamat, posce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:63 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 63 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37168.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate and abstract subjects, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod res poscere videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum usus poscit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: quod negotium poscebat, Sail J. 56, 1; 70, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:162" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 162</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n37168.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37168.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand for punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ask the surrender of</hi>: accusant <pb n="1403" /> <cb n="POST" /> ii, quos populus poscit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus tantae cladis auctor Annibal poscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec poscitur auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:44" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscendum poenae juvenem jubebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:677" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 677</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37168.9" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> one (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">clamore hominem posco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitu Alciden,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1887" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1887</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: ego poscor Olympo (<hi rend="ital">dat. of agent</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Olympus calls me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summons me to the combat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 533</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37168.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex tua numina posco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 666</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37168.11" n="C" level="2"> In selling. </sense><sense id="n37168.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi> for a thing, <hi rend="ital">to offer at</hi> a price: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti quanti poscit, vin' tanti illam emi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: pro reliquis (libris) idem pretium poposcit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37168.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer a price</hi> for a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">agite licemini. Qui cenā poscit? ecqui poscit prandio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37168.14" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand one's hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ask in marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam si jubes, frater, tibi me poscere, poscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam tuam mihi uxorem posco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi permittam, posce, duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine dote posco tuam sororem filio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam sororem uxorem alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
posea: <entryFree id="n37169" type="main" key="po_se^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōsĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pausea.</entryFree>
posides: <entryFree id="n37170" type="main" key="Po^si_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏsīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedman of the emperor Claudius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 91</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏsīdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Posidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
posideum: <entryFree id="n37171" type="main" key="Po^si_de_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏsīdēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n37171.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory of Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37171.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory of Pallene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posidonia: <entryFree id="n37172" type="main" key="Po^si_do_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏsīdōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name of Pœstum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posidonius: <entryFree id="n37173" type="main" key="Po^si_do_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏsīdōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*poseidw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n37173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Stoic at Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Panœtius and instructor of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
posimerium: <entryFree id="n37174" type="gloss" key="po_si^me_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōsĭmērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. pomerium.</entryFree>
positio: <entryFree id="n37175" type="main" key="po^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pono</etym>, <sense id="n37175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting</hi> (post-Aug.; in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26, 62</bibl>, possessione is the correct reading). </sense><sense id="n37175.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calicis positio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 36" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a position</hi> of the body or of places, <hi rend="ital">a posture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis nostri positio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli locique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro situ et positione locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:21:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiae procurrentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniuscujusque stellarum forma et positio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37175.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A placing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi> of a word: <foreign lang="greek">metwnumi/a</foreign> est nominis pro nomine positio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:51" default="NO">1, 5, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">affirmation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas non per positionem sed per detractionem dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37175.7" n="1" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:40" default="NO">7, 4, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.8" n="2" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">an ending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">termination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 60</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10" default="NO">1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl>; 22.—</sense><sense id="n37175.9" n="3" level="3"> In prosody. </sense><sense id="n37175.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A downward beat</hi>, in marking time: <cit><quote lang="la">a sublatione ad positionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 981</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">of the voice</hi> (opp. elevatio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 16, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.11" n="b" level="4"> Positio syllabae, <hi rend="ital">the place of a short vowel before two consonants</hi>, by which the syllable becomes long, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:86" default="NO">9, 4, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 423</bibl> P. et saep.—</sense><sense id="n37175.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A state of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quācumque positione mentis sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37175.13" n="5" level="3"> Positiones, <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi> of a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
positivus: <entryFree id="n37176" type="main" key="po^si^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">positive</hi>, in gram. </sense><sense id="n37176.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Settled by arbitrary appointment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi> (opp. to natural): <cit><quote lang="la">nomina non positiva esse sed naturalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37176.2" n="II" level="1"> Positivum nomen. </sense><sense id="n37176.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An adjective in the positive degree</hi>, Cledon. p. 1893 P.—</sense><sense id="n37176.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A substantive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
positor: <entryFree id="n37177" type="main" key="po^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a builder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi> (Ovid): <cit><quote lang="la">moenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
positura: <entryFree id="n37178" type="main" key="po^si^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n37178.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sideris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—With a subject. <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the formation of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 36.—</sense><sense id="n37178.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37178.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37178.3" n="B" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">pointing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpunction</hi>, Don. p. 1742 P. al. <cb n="POSS" /></sense></entryFree>
positus: <entryFree id="n37179" type="main" key="po^si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pono.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37180" type="main" key="po^si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pono</etym>, <sense id="n37180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situation; disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi> (rare; ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only once in Sallust): positu variare capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 412</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: insulae, Sall. Fragm. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 47</bibl> (p. 247 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">regionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dubium positu Urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Trinacris, a positu nomen adepta loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:420" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 420</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">ways of arranging</hi> the hair, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
possessio: <entryFree id="n37181" type="main" key="possessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>possido</etym>. <sense id="n37181.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taking</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">kth=sis</foreign>), bonorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere in possessionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to send to take possession</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Monam insulam, a cujus possessione revocatum Paulinum memoravi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mare intretur, promptam ipsis possessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37181.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37181.2" n="A" level="2"> In abstr., <hi rend="ital">a possessing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessio est, ut definit Gallus Aelius, usus quidam agri, aut aedificii, non ipse fundus, aut ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> ib.: possessio appellata est, ut Labeo ait, a sedibus, quasi positio, quia naturaliter tenetur ab eo, qui ei insistit, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">katoxh\n</foreign> dicunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certā re et possessione deturbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in possessionem proficisci,</quote> <trans><tr>to come into possession</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 27, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in possessionem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in possessionem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in possessione bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem bonorum dare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere se in possessione,</quote> <trans><tr>to take possession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ignis prima possessio rerum fuit, qui paulatim exstinctus, sedem terris dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>if at first fire possessed the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37181.3" n="B" level="2"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a thing possessed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">an estate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones appellantur agri late patentes, publici privatique: qui non mancipatione, sed usu tenebantur, et, ut quisque occupaverat, possidebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=241" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 241</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">prata et areas quasdam magno aestimant, quod ei generi possessionum minime noceri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui trans Rhodanum vicos possessionesque habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum meis nominibus ex possessionibus solvere possem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37181.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">possession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentiae doctrinaeque possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii ac defensionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 49, 200</bibl></cit>: laud is, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 2</bibl>: res publica in possessione victoriae permanebit, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 21, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
possessiuncula: <entryFree id="n37182" type="hapax" key="possessi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>possessio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n37182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small estate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si attenuatus frater tuus vendiderit possessiunculam ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 25, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
possessivus: <entryFree id="n37183" type="main" key="possessi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>possideo</etym>, <sense id="n37183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessive;</hi> a gram. t. t. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomina (e. g. Ciceronianus, Evandrius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 128</bibl></cit> P. and A.: <cit><quote lang="la">pronomina (e. g. meus, tuus, suus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: casus, <hi rend="ital">the possessive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">genitive case</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 670</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
possessor: <entryFree id="n37184" type="main" key="possessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a possessor</hi> (class.) </sense><sense id="n37184.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni inertis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 779</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 49</bibl>.—Esp. t. t. in law (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">the possessor of the thing claimed;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the defendant</hi> in a suit (opp. petitor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 36, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37184.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo possessor Italici litoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
possessorius: <entryFree id="n37185" type="main" key="possesso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>possessor</etym>, <sense id="n37185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessory</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:section=145" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:50" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.<</sense></entryFree>
possessus: <entryFree id="n37186" type="main" key="possessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from possideo and possido.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37187" type="main" key="possessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n37187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>possideo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">possession</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
possestrix: <entryFree id="n37188" type="main" key="possestrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possestrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>possessor</etym>, <sense id="n37188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that possesses</hi> (ante-class.), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 28</bibl>. <cb n="POSS" /></sense></entryFree>
possibilis: <entryFree id="n37189" type="main" key="possi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>possum</etym>, <sense id="n37189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may exist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">may be done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possible</hi> (post-Aug.): melius qui tertiam partem dixerunt <foreign lang="greek">dunato/n</foreign>, quod nostri possibile nominant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: possibile est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 25, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">possĭ-bĭlĭter</orth>, Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 2, 52.</sense></entryFree>
possibilitas: <entryFree id="n37190" type="main" key="possi^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>possibilis</etym>, <sense id="n37190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ability to do a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 335</bibl></cit>: pro possibilitate, <hi rend="ital">according to ability</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
possideo: <entryFree id="n37191" type="main" key="possi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possĭdĕo</orth> (archaic orthogr. POSIDET, Epitaphs of the Scipios; Sentent. de Limit. Genuat. Rudorff; in the latter also POSIDENT, POSIDEBVNT, POSIDETO, POSIDERE, as well as POSEDEIT and POSEDET, for possedit), <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>old <pos>prep.</pos> port; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">proti/, pro/s</foreign> (v. pono), and sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n37191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have and hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess</hi> (syn.: teneo, habeo). </sense><sense id="n37191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti nunc possidetis eum fundum q. d. a. (i. e. quo de agitur), quod nec vi nec clam nec precario alter ab altero possidetis, ita possidentis: adversus ea vim fieri veto, an ancient formula of the prætor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in alienā potestate sunt, rem peculiarem tenere possunt, habere et possidere non possunt: quia possessio non tantum corporis, sed etiam juris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex edicto bona possidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum bello captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli Italiam maximis plurimisque urbibus possident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37191.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to have possessions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to possess lands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be settled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta litora maris possidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:9:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possidere trans flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:14:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37191.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for possido, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to occupy</hi> (very rare except in eccl. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego possideo plus Pallante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot agri jugera?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 141</bibl></cit>: ferro septus possidet sedes sacras, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
