Her.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum armatis catervis perditorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:42:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 42, 110</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">magister, quid faciendo vitam aeternam possidebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqui regnum Dei non possidebunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 6, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n37191.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide in</hi> a place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">victrix possidet umbra nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:76:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 76, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyri possidet aura nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 454</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37191.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">possidere nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secli mores in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: inverecundum animi ingenium, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:45:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 45, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus fidei quam artis, plus veritatis quam disciplinae possidet in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:586" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 586</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possedit favorem plebis Clodius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
possido: <entryFree id="n37192" type="main" key="possi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>causat. of possideo, q. v.</etym>. <sense id="n37192.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to possess one's self of</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo, occupo, potior): bona alicujus sine testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 283</bibl></cit>: regnum, Auct. B. Alex. 34.—Of inanim. subjects (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aër omne possidat inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluus humor Ultima possedit,</quote> <trans><tr>took possession of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis cuncta possedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37192.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess itself of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to occupy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">brevi tempore totum hominem, totamque ejus praeturam possederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68:section=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68, § 158</bibl></cit>.<</sense></entryFree>
possum: <entryFree id="n37193" type="main" key="possum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">possum</orth>, <itype>pŏtŭi, posse</itype>, <sense id="n37193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. irreg.</hi> (old forms, potis sum, for possum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 23</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">potis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potis sunt, for possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: POTISIT, S. C. de Bacchan.: potisset, for posset, and potisse, for posse, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 32</bibl>, and 445, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">potesse, for posse, very freq.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 30 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 665</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1010" default="NO" valid="yes">1010</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potis sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potis siem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: possies, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, or Sat. v. 38 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 13 al.</bibl>; cf. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:884" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 884</bibl>; Fleck. Krit. Misc. p. 45 sq.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: potestur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 380</bibl> P. (Ann. <pb n="1404" /> <cb n="POSS" /> v. 594 Vahl.): Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 29</bibl>; Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 508, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1010" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1010</bibl>: poteratur, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 27</bibl>: possitur, Lex. Servil. p. 59 Haubold; Scaurus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 381</bibl> P.: possetur, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 18</bibl>) [potis-sum]. </sense><sense id="n37193.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have power; I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">can</hi> (syn. queo): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum valeam, quantumque possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio, quantum potero, labore plus paene quam potero exeubabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quoad possem et liceret, a senis latere nunquam discederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor igitur ab iis aegritudinem potuit repellere, ratio non poterit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tuse. 3, 27, 66</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesari te commendavi et tradidi, ut gravissime diligentissimeque potui,</quote> <trans><tr>as earnestly and warmly as I possibly could</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: potest fieri, <hi rend="ital">it may be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is possible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest fieri, ut fallar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: non possum quin, <hi rend="ital">I can not but</hi>: non possum quin exclamem, ut ait ille in Trinummo (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 107</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil ad te dem litterarum, facere non possum,</quote> <trans><tr>I cannot help writing to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere non potui quin tibi sententiam declararem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum non: aequitatem tuam non potui non probare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum te non accusare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is non potest eam (mortem) non timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: potest (sc. fieri), <hi rend="ital">it may be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is possible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest, ut alii ita arbitrentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: non, non sic futurum est; <cit><quote lang="la">non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 100</bibl> Brix; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (mala) si potest singula consolando levare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos dignitatem, ut potest, retinebimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Quantum or ut potest, <hi rend="ital">as much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">as far as possible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo atque arcessam medicum, quantum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in senatu dignitatem nostram, ut potest in tantā hominum perfidiā, retinebimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—In urgent questions: <cit><quote lang="la">possum scire, quo profectus, cujus sis, aut quid veneris?</quote> <trans><tr>may I know? can I learn? pray</tr>, <tr>will you tell me?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possumne ego hodie ex te exsculpere Verum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37193.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37193.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have influence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avail.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37193.4" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc.</hi> used adverbially (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">polleo): vocat me, quae in me plus potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus potest qui plus valet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tum et poterant per vim et scelus plurimum, et quod poterant, id audebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo? hoc pueri possunt, viri non poterunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui apud me et amicitiā, et beneficiis, et dignitate plurimum possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus aliquanto apud te pecuniae cupiditas, quam judicii metus potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid aristolochia ad morsus serpentum possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam multum potest provisio animi ad minuendum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad beate vivendum satis posse virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: multum posse ad salutem alterius ... parum potuisse ad exitium, Cic. Opp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., and without <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">posse litteras ejus ad perniciem, non posse ad salutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 79, p. 324</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.6" n="B" level="2"> Posse aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to be able to embrace</hi> one (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.7" n="C" level="2"> Posse as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">posse loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>the power of speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse moveri = facultatem se movendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.8" n="D" level="2"> Freq. in elliptical sentences: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vi non poterant, fraude assequi temptant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ismenias, etsi publicis non poterat, privatis tamen viribus adjuvabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:9:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut auxilium quod misericordiā non poterat, jure cognationis obtineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut collegam vi, si aliter non possent, de foro abducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.9" n="E" level="2"> In apodosis of conditional sentences, analogous to the auxiliaries of the Engl. potential mood (v. Roby, § 1520; Zumpt, § 519). </sense><sense id="n37193.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille potuit exspectatior venire, qui te nuntiaret mortuom (= si quis nuntiaret, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero ipsam amicitiam tueri possumus, nisi aeque amicos et nosmet ipsos diligamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius munitiones Caesaris prohibere non poterat, nisi praelio decertare vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: consul esse qui potui, nisi <cb n="POST" /> eum vitae cursum tenuissem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(res publica) poterat esse perpetua, si patriis viveretur institutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deleri totus exercitus potuit, si fugientis persecuti victores essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi felicitas in socordiam vertisset exuere jugum potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui denique ex bestiis fructus, nisi homines adjuvarent, percipi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum quidem erat eo, ut, si hostem similem antiquis Macedonum regibus habuisset consul, magna clades accipi potuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—So when the condition is implied, or is contained in an adverbial clause: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res egestati et aeri alieno tuo praeter mortem Caesaris subvenire potuisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis opifex praeter naturam ... tantam sollertiam persequi potuisset in sensibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima proferre possemus, sed modus adhibendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possem hic Ciceronis respondere verbis, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> potentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 519</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 114</bibl>), <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37193.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amplae atque potentes civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae clarae ac potentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici magni et potentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis ex plebe contra potentiorem auxilii egeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo potentissimi reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentissimus et clarissimus civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta sit humani ingenii vis, quam potens efficiendi quae velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma potens opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:255" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā et orbitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.15" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compensare potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37193.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Having power over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruling over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master of</hi> a thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum liber, dum mei potens sum,</quote> <trans><tr>as long as I am my own master</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanus mentisque potens,</quote> <trans><tr>in his right mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:139" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potens mei non eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentes rerum suarum atque urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>having made themselves masters of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; so, facere aliquem potentem alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">to make one master of any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give one the power over a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 42, 12</bibl></cit>: diva potens Cypri, <hi rend="ital">that reigns over Cyprus</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naïadum potens (Bacchus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum potens Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva potens uteri,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Lucina</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium potens Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae Musa potens,</quote> <trans><tr>that presides over lyric poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <trans><tr>master of his anger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mariti,</quote> <trans><tr>ruling her husband</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal potens leti,</quote> <trans><tr>that can kill</tr>, <tr>deadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 485</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 199</bibl> Corte ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n37193.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fit for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capable of</hi> any thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potens regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 2</bibl></cit>: hostes neque pugnae, neque fugae satis potentes caeduntur, <hi rend="ital">unable either to fight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.19" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Partaking of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having attained</hi> a thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pacis potentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussi,</quote> <trans><tr>having fulfilled the command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:509" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 509</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37193.20" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potent</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna in res bellicas potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba potens ad opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba potens adversus ranas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 81, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passum ex uvis contra haemorrhoida potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 12, § 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse potentius auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam ad efficiendum potentiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentissimae cantharides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mightily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effectually</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsam potenter atque efficaciter defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 72</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ... perrumpere amat saxa potentius Ictu fulmineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37193.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">According to one's ability</hi> or <hi rend="ital">powers</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lecta potenter res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
post: <entryFree id="n37194" type="main" key="post"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post</orth> (form poste, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> An. 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 56</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>root pas-; Sanscr. pac-kas, behind; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu/matos</foreign> (for <foreign lang="greek">po/smatos</foreign>); Lat. pone, postremus</etym>. <sense id="n37194.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37194.1" n="A" level="2"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ante aut post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, qui post erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertis priora genua post curvantur,</quote> <trans><tr>backwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 102, § 249</bibl></cit>: sed <cb n="POST" /> ubi periculum advenit, invidia atque superbia post fuere, <hi rend="ital">remained behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were forgotten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post minor est,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>shorter when seen from behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:504" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 504</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37194.2" n="B" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after</hi>: nunc et post semper, old poet in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37194.3" n="2" level="3"> Ante ... post, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 47 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">post duobus mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initio ... post autem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:55:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 55, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 8</bibl>: duxi probum, erravi, post cognovi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 160 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">multis post annis,</quote> <trans><tr>many years after</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis diebus post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis annis post,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennio post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>: quam te post multis tueor tempestatibus? <hi rend="ital">after how long a time?</hi> Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 414, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto post,</quote> <trans><tr>some time after</tr>, <tr>shortly after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post aliquanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo post valens,</quote> <trans><tr>a little later</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post paulo,</quote> <trans><tr>soon after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo post quam,</quote> <trans><tr>long after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 14</bibl> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">post tanto,</quote> <trans><tr>so long after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post non multo,</quote> <trans><tr>not long afterwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ita multo,</quote> <trans><tr>and not very long afterwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>: et post inde, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 59</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 11 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">inde pedes et crura mori, post inde per artus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... post deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37194.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">behind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37194.5" n="A" level="2"> Of place: post me erat Aegina, ante Megara, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post nostra castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tergum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post carecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post montem se occultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post se alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 9, 58, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post equitem sedet atra cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37194.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">less important than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque erat Lydia post Chloen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus erat ambitionis furor, ut nemo tibi post te videatur, si aliquis ante te fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sua necessaria post illius honorem haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37194.7" n="B" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot post menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima post hominum memoriam classis,</quote> <trans><tr>since the memory of man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post M. Brutum proconsulem,</quote> <trans><tr>after the proconsulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">post urbem conditam,</quote> <trans><tr>since the city was founded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post homines natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexennio post Veios captos,</quote> <trans><tr>after the taking of Veii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100 al.</bibl></cit> —Put after the noun: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decessit post annum quartum quam expulsus fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">post annum quintum, quo expulsus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: post id, post illa, <hi rend="ital">after this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post id cum lassus fueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: qui foret post illa natus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. v. 67 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum numquam post illa vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post haec deinde,</quote> <trans><tr>then after this</tr>, <tr>and next</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post Hectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 607</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37194.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post sidera caeli sola Jovem Semele vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:10:22" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 10, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postauctumnalis: <entryFree id="n37195" type="main" key="postauctumna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-auctumnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-autumn-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">post - autumnal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postea: <entryFree id="n37196" type="main" key="poste^a_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕā</orth> (in some edd. also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post ĕa</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>post- and <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> ea, orig. eā, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 769</etym>. <sense id="n37196.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">After this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Considius, qui in exercitu P. Sullae, et postea in M. Crassi fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea, cum mihi nihil scriberetur, verebar ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea vero quam equitatus in conspectum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">abl. of difference of time</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">postea aliquanto,</quote> <trans><tr>a little while after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis postea mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi postea mortuus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multo postea,</quote> <trans><tr>not long after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo postea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo postea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.— So with <hi rend="ital">adv. of time</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non diu postea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud longe postea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe autem postea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inde</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deinceps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <pb n="1405" /> <cb n="POST" /> <hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati deinde postea missi ab rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde postea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 14</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">postea quam</orth> (also as one word, posteaquam), <hi rend="ital">after that</hi> (very freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam ego in Siciliam veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam honoribus inservire coepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam nuntii venerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam Agesilaum misere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam tantam multitudinem conlegerat emblematum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit> (cf. Zumpt, § <cit><quote lang="la">507 b).—So, too, postea vero quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postea autem quam ei nuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea (or post ea) loci for postea: post ea loci consul pervenit in oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37196.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37196.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Afterwards</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 131</bibl> (dub.).—</sense><sense id="n37196.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in consequence of this</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne haec justa tibi videntur postea?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 26</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, quid postea?</quote> <trans><tr>what next? what further? what then?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid postea, si Romae assiduus fui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at enim nemo post reges exactos de plebe consul fuit: quid postea?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
posteaquam: <entryFree id="n37197" type="main" key="poste^a_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕāquam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. postea, I.</entryFree>
postella: <entryFree id="n37198" type="gloss" key="postella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, i. q. postilena, <sense id="n37198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crupper</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posteo: <entryFree id="n37199" type="main" key="poste^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to be inferior to;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poster: <entryFree id="n37200" type="main" key="poster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">poster</orth>, v. posterus.</entryFree>
posterganeus: <entryFree id="n37201" type="main" key="posterga_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postergānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>post-tergum</etym>, <sense id="n37201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is behind one's back</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
posteri: <entryFree id="n37202" type="main" key="poste^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. posterus, I.</entryFree>
posterior: <entryFree id="n37203" type="main" key="poste^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <sense id="n37203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> from posterus.</sense></entryFree>
posteritas: <entryFree id="n37204" type="main" key="poste^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>posterus</etym>, <sense id="n37204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">future time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">futurity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after - ages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeding generations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sperare videor, Scipionis et Laelii amicitiam notam posteritati fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus rei ne posteritatem quidem omnium saeculorum, umquam immemorem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sera,</quote> <trans><tr>a late posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritati servire,</quote> <trans><tr>one's fame with posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritatis otio consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat rationem posteritatis et periculi sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: in posteritatem, <hi rend="ital">in the distant future</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta tempestas invidiae nobis ...in posteritatem impendeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola posteritatis dilectio,</quote> <trans><tr>desire for offspring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 8, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37204.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37204.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the last place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferiority</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">principalem veritati, et posteritatem mendacitati deputare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postero: <entryFree id="n37205" type="main" key="poste^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>.—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n37205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be behind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">later</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come after</hi>,—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be inferior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come short of</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(stere/w</foreign> (post-class.): cum oliva tota nigrescet, quod speciei merito posteravit, fundendi ubertate compensat, Pall 12, 4.</sense></entryFree>
posterula: <entryFree id="n37206" type="main" key="poste^ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n37206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f dim.</hi> (sc. janua or via) [id.]. </sense><sense id="n37206.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small back door</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a postern</hi> (post-class.): posterulae proditio, Cassian. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Coenob. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37206.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A back-way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by-way</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posterus: <entryFree id="n37207" type="main" key="poste^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">poster</orth> (not in use in <sense id="n37207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing. masc.</hi>), a, um, <hi rend="ital">adj.—Comp</hi>: posterior, us.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: postremus or postumus, a, um [post], <hi rend="ital">coming after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensuing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">future.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37207.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ibi diem posterum commoraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum diem distulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die mane,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 2, 17, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die, Sall J. 75, 9: posterā nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero anno, Cic. Fragm. pro C. Cornel.: postera aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterā Crescam laude,</quote> <trans><tr>in the esteem of posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteri dies,</quote> <trans><tr>unlucky</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 73, 32</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n37207.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">coming generations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expetantur eae poenae a liberis, a nepotibus, a posteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterūm gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero, for postero die,</quote> <trans><tr>on the following day</tr>, <tr>next day</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minimum credula postero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: in posterum, for in <cb n="POST" /> posterum diem, <hi rend="ital">to the following day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till the next day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum oppugnationem differt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—More freq.: in posterum (sc. tempus), <hi rend="ital">in the future</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the future</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum confirmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum in posterum providerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe in posterum prospicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37207.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 333</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37207.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕ-rĭor</orth>, postĕrĭus. </sense><sense id="n37207.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that comes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">follows after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">later</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterior</hi> (class.; strictly only when two objects or classes are contrasted in place or time; <cit><quote lang="la">opp.: prior, superior): ut cum priore (dicto) necessario posterius cohaerere videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:46:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 46, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec acumine posteriorum (oratorum), nec fulmine utens superiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pertinere ad superiorem divisionem: contra posteriorem nihil dici oportere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteriores pedes (opp.: pedes priores),</quote> <trans><tr>the hind feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 248</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 45, 102, § 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars prior apparet, posteriora latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:718" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteriores cogitationes,</quote> <trans><tr>afterthoughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paria esse debent posteriora superioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucy dides paulo aetate posterior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod prius ordine verbum est, Posterius facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 59</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes added to other words of contrast: <cit><quote lang="la">alii ... alii ... tamen hi quoque posteriores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus est ratio duplex ... facilior est haec posterior ... sed illa lautior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. superior.—</sense><sense id="n37207.6" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37207.7" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕ-rĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for posteri, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum omnes cognati supra tritavum, generali appellatione majores vocantur, ita post trinepotem posteriores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37207.8" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕrĭōra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the posteriors</hi> (post-class.), Lampr Elag. 5. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">postĕrĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">later</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">posterius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterius istuc dicis quam credo tibi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I believe you before you speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet posterius ad se reverti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 29, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides si posterius fuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had he lived at a later period</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37207.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of less account</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worse</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quorum utrique semper patriae salus et dignitas posterior suā dominatione et domesticis commodis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam salutem posteriorem communi salute ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil posterius, nihil nequius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit> (al. protervius): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes res posteriores pono atque operam do tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>I lay every thing aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: non posteriores feram, <hi rend="ital">I will not play the meanest part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I shall not be behindhand</hi>, Ter Ad. 5, 4, 26; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus sic fortuna cum improbitate certavit, ut nemo posset utrum posterior an infelicior esset judicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Prov Cons. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n37207.10" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup</hi>, in two forms, postrēmus and postŭmus, a, um. </sense><sense id="n37207.11" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postrēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the hindmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alia prima ponet, alia postrema,</quote> <trans><tr>last</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <trans><tr>the rear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agmine in primis modo, modo in postremis adesse,</quote> <trans><tr>now in the front</tr>, <tr>now in the rear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 45, 2</bibl></cit>: postremā in comoediā, <hi rend="ital">at the end of the piece</hi>, Plaut. Cist. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in postremo libro,</quote> <trans><tr>at the close of the book</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mense postremo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus, i. e. exsequiae,</quote> <trans><tr>the last honors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 101, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec postrema cura,</quote> <trans><tr>not the last</tr>, <tr>least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 404</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non in postremis, i. e. in primis,</quote> <trans><tr>especially</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">postrēmō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes urbes, agri, regna denique, postremo etiam vectigalia vestra venierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... deinde ... postremo: denique ... postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 132</bibl>: ad postremum, <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ultimately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ad postremum nihil apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; Sall. Fragm. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl>: postremum, <hi rend="ital">for the last time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id facis, hodie postremum me vides, Ter And. 2, 1, 22: in quo (vestigio) ille postremum institisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: postremum, <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremum mel et acetum superfundes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37207.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worst</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">postremum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: ut homines postremi pecuniis alienis locupletarentur,<cb n="POST" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus postremum malorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 113</bibl></cit>.—Hence, ante- and post-class., a new <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> postremior, and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> postremissimus: <cit><quote lang="la">ut possit videri nullum animal in terris homine postremius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: omnium nationum postremissimum nequissimumque existimatote, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adulescentulis postremissimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 336</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37207.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">po-stŭmus</orth> (acc. to an erroneous derivation, from post - humus, sometimes also <orth extent="full" lang="la">post-humus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi>, said esp. of the youngest children, or of those born after the father's death, or after he had made his will, <hi rend="ital">late-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posthumous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvius ... tua postuma proles, Quem tibi longaevo serum Lavinia conjux Educet silvis,</quote> <trans><tr>late-born son</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 763</bibl></cit>; cf. with this passage: postuma proles non eum significat, qui patre mortuo, sed qui postremo loco natus est, sicuti Silvius, qui Aeneā jam sene, tardo seroque partu est editus, Caesellius Vindex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl>.—On the other hand: <cit><quote lang="la">is, qui post patris mortem natus est, dicitur postumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 60</bibl></cit> Müll.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">postumus cognominatur post patris mortem natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl></cit> Müll.; Plaut. ap. Fest. l. l.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a posthumous child</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minus postumis quam jam natis testamento tutores dari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:147" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis postumis dederit tutores, hique vivo eo nascantur, an datio valeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postuma spes,</quote> <trans><tr>the last</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipit doctrinam seram plane et postumam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 297, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena quam postumā diligentiā praeparaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>with extreme care</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 6, p. 186, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n37207.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de postumo corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postfactus: <entryFree id="n37208" type="main" key="postfactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postfactus</orth>, <itype>or separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post fac-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the obsol. postfacio, <sense id="n37208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">done afterwards</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">post facta furta (opp. ante facta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex postfacto,</quote> <trans><tr>from what is done afterwards</tr>, <tr>afterwards</tr>, <tr>subsequently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (20, 1, 22).</sense></entryFree>
postfero: <entryFree id="n37209" type="main" key="postfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-fĕro</orth>, <itype>ferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to esteem less</hi> (not before the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">qui libertati plebis suas opes postferrent,</quote> <trans><tr>sacrificed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 64, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatinius nulli non postferendus (opp.: Brutus cuilibet praeferendus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postferte fidem regnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:701" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non postferuntur et Charites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi et corporis robore nulli juvenum postferendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postfuturi: <entryFree id="n37210" type="main" key="postfu^tu_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-fŭtūri, post fŭtūrum</orth>, v. postsum.</entryFree>
postgenitus: <entryFree id="n37211" type="hapax" key="postge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>or separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born afterwards;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">postgĕnĭti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendants</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posthabeo: <entryFree id="n37212" type="main" key="postha^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-hăbĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem less</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes posthabui mihi res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus posthabitis,</quote> <trans><tr>neglecting every thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posthabitā Samo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posthabitam dote solatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posthabui illorum mea seria ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
