posthac: <entryFree id="n37213" type="main" key="posthac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-hac</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">henceforth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in future</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliam posthac invenito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 165</bibl>; S. C. de Bacchan.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam posthac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:99:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 99, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. nunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. antea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis erit providendum, quā condicione posthac eos esse velitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posthaec: <entryFree id="n37214" type="main" key="posthaec"><orth extent="full" lang="la">posthaec</orth> (or as two words, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post haec</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after this</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl>, etc.; v. post.</sense></entryFree>
posthinc: <entryFree id="n37215" type="spur" key="posthinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">posthinc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi>, etc.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 546</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 300</bibl>, more correctly separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post hinc</orth>.</sense></entryFree>
posthoc: <entryFree id="n37216" type="main" key="posthoc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">posthoc</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">post hoc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = postea, <sense id="n37216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posthumius: <entryFree id="n37217" type="main" key="Posthu^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Posthŭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, v. Postumius.</entryFree>
posthumus: <entryFree id="n37218" type="main" key="posthu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">posthŭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. posterus, III. B.</entryFree>
postibi: <entryFree id="n37219" type="main" key="posti^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-ĭbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <pb n="1406" /> <cb n="POST" /> <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postica: <entryFree id="n37220" type="main" key="posti_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. posticus.</entryFree>
posticipo: <entryFree id="n37221" type="main" key="posti^ci^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĭcĭpo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>post-capio</etym>, <sense id="n37221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive afterwards</hi> (post-class.), opp. anticipare, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posticula: <entryFree id="n37222" type="main" key="posti_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>postica</etym>, <sense id="n37222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little backdoor</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">brevis posticula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
posticulum: <entryFree id="n37223" type="main" key="posti_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postīcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>posticum</etym>, <sense id="n37223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small back building</hi> (Plautinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
posticum: <entryFree id="n37224" type="main" key="posti_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postīcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. posticus.</entryFree>
posticus: <entryFree id="n37225" type="main" key="posti_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>post; like anticus from ante</etym>. <sense id="n37225.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>-, <hi rend="ital">posterior</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam hic ostium aliud posticum nostrarum aedium,</quote> <trans><tr>backdoor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: posticum ostium dicitur in posteriore parte aedium. Ceterum antiqui etiam vicinum habitantem ad posteriorem partem aedium sic appellarunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus erat posticis aedium partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8</bibl></cit>: perrexit in interiores partes domuis posticae, <hi rend="ital">of the backbuilding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out - house</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo posticā egressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 42</bibl></cit> Müll.: vicinus, v. Paul. ex Fest. l. l.: non peperit, verum posticā parte profudit, <hi rend="ital">with the posteriors</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sannae,</quote> <trans><tr>made behind the back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:62" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>hind feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars palatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posticam lineam in agris dividendis Serv. Sulpicius appellavit, ab exoriente sole ad occidentem quae spectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl></cit> Müll.: quae ante nos sunt, antica: et quae post nos sunt, postica dicuntur: et dextram anticam, sinistram posticam dicimus. Sic etiam ea caeli pars, quae sole illustratur ad meridiem, antica nominatur, quae ad septentrionem postica, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus templi partes quattuor dicuntur: sinistra ab oriente, dextra ab occasu, antica ad meridiem, postica ad septentrionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 7</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n37225.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37225.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a backdoor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 217, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37225.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postīcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37225.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A backdoor</hi> (the prevailing form for this signif.): <cit><quote lang="la">per posticum se conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria servantem postico falle clientem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37225.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The back part</hi> of a building, <hi rend="ital">the rear front</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pronao, et postico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37225.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A backhouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privy</hi> (anteclass.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37225.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The posteriors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fundament</hi> (ante- and postclass.): retrimenta cibi, quae exierunt per posticum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 24</bibl>; also in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postidea: <entryFree id="n37226" type="main" key="posti^de^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĭdĕa</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, ante-class. lengthened form for postea, <sense id="n37226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quo profectus sum, ibo, postidea domum me recipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 67</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">loci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postidea loci, Qui deliquit, vapulabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:Grex. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. Grex. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postilena: <entryFree id="n37227" type="main" key="posti^le_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĭlēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>post</etym>, <sense id="n37227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crupper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postilio: <entryFree id="n37228" type="main" key="posti^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>postulo; cf. consilium from consulo</etym>. Relig. t. t., <sense id="n37228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a claim of a god upon men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a demand for the fulfilment of a forgotten sacrifice</hi> (cf. postulatio, with which it is confounded in many MSS. and edd.; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly ante- and post-class.): de eā re scriptum est, postiliones esse Jovi, Saturno, Neptuno, Telluri, dis caelestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem ostento Telluri postilio deberi dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum Manium postilionem postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=148" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 148</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in caeremoniis vestris postulionibus locus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postilla: <entryFree id="n37229" type="main" key="postilla_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postillā</orth>, <itype>or separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post illa</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cf. postea</etym>, <sense id="n37229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi> (anteclass. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): postilla, germana soror, errare videbar, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 42 Vahl.): saepe post illa operam rei publicae fortem perhibuit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eum, qui mihi vendidit illam, numquam postilla vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:84:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 84, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postis: <entryFree id="n37230" type="main" key="postis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n37230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> posti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 120</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pono</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">door-post.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37230.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput legis in curiae poste figere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: armis Herculis ad <cb n="POST" /> postem fixis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur invidendis postibus moliar atrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere postem, said of him who consecrates a temple,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:46:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 46, 120</bibl>.—Also of other edifices: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulationis postes nemo umquam tenuit in dedicando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:46:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 46, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37230.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a door</hi> (usually in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">postes a cardine vellit Aeratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerati procumbunt cardine postes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 493</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:322" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perunguere postis, ne quid mali medicamenti inferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 142</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">poste recluso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 531</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37230.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): belli ferratos postes portasque refregit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 622</bibl> (Ann. v. 271 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">videtur Cernere res animus, sublatis postibus ipsis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 369</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postliminium: <entryFree id="n37231" type="main" key="postli_mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postlīmĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>post - limen</etym>, prop., <sense id="n37231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a return behind one's threshold</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to one's home;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a return to one's old condition and former privileges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the right to return home and resume one's former rank and privileges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the right of recovery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprisal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postliminium</hi>: cum ipsius postliminii vis quaeritur, et verbum ipsum notatur, Servius noster nihil putat esse notandum, nisi post; <cit><quote lang="la">et liminium illud productionem esse verbi vult, ut in finitimo, legitimo, aeditimo non plus inesse timum, quam in meditullio tullium. Scaevola autem Publii filius junctum putat esse verbum, ut sit in eo et post, et limen: ut quae a nobis alienata sunt, cum ad hostem pervenerint, et ex suo tamquam limine exierint, dein cum redierint post ad idem limen, postliminio videantur rediisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem pater suus aut populus vendidisset, aut pater patratus dedidisset, ei nullum esse postliminium,</quote> <trans><tr>has no right to return to his house and his old privileges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postliminii jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:15:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: postliminium dare alicui, ib.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37231.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postlīmĭniō</orth>, adverbial <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n37231.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by the right of postliminium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postliminio redeunt haec, homo, navis, equus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civi Romano licet esse Gaditanum, sive exsilio, sive postliminio, sive rejectione hujus civitatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when he returns to Gades</tr>, <tr>where he was a citizen before being one at Rome</tr>, <tr>and recovers his right of citizenship</tr>, <tr>which he had lost by the attainment of Roman citizenship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37231.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by the right of return</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anew</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">postliminio in forum cupedinis reducens,</quote> <trans><tr>leading back again</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 123, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus postliminio mortis animare,</quote> <trans><tr>after death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 127, 4.—</sense><sense id="n37231.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postliminium ecclesiasticae pacis,</quote> <trans><tr>reconciliation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postmeridianus: <entryFree id="n37232" type="main" key="postme^ri_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postmĕrīdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pomeridianus.</entryFree>
postmodo: <entryFree id="n37233" type="main" key="postmo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-mŏdo</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post mŏdo</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in Livy for postea; not in Plaut., Cic., Cæs., or Quint.): tamen postmodo necesse est doleant, Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentiet illa tuas postmodo capta manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 1), 18; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 11</bibl> (Fleck.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 486</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegis immeritis nocituram Postmodo te natis fraudem committere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum in praesentiā dedecus, postmodo periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 41, 5</bibl>; 4, 7, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:4 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 4 al.</bibl>; cf. postmodum.</sense></entryFree>
postmodum: <entryFree id="n37234" type="main" key="postmo^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postmŏdum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>post-modus</etym>, <sense id="n37234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ex injuriā postmodum gratiam ortam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne postmodum flecti precibus aut donis regiis posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 7</bibl> Weissenb. (al. postmodo); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10" default="NO">2, 10</bibl>, ext. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:17" default="NO">5, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:6" default="NO">6, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postomis: <entryFree id="n37235" type="greek" key="posto^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŏmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from <foreign lang="greek">pro/stomos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n37235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barnacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twitch</hi>, an instrument fixed upon the nostrils of unruly horses; hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a drinking-cup</hi>, from its being always at a tippler's nose (anteclass.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 27</bibl> (al. prostomides): postomis, <foreign lang="greek">e)pistomi/s</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
postpartor: <entryFree id="n37236" type="main" key="postpartor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-partor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inheritor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heir</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">unde anteparta demus postpartoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postpono: <entryFree id="n37237" type="main" key="postpo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone; to esteem less</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to neglect.</hi> <cb n="POST" /> <hi rend="ital">disregard</hi> (class., but not in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">post habeo, praetermitto): ut omnia postponere videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: omnia postposui, dummodo praeceptis patris parerem, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorto postponere honestum Officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>: postponere Hannibalem Alexandro Magno. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus postpositis,</quote> <trans><tr>laying every thing else aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postpositus: <entryFree id="n37238" type="main" key="postpo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from postpono.</entryFree>
postprincipia: <entryFree id="n37239" type="main" key="postprinci^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-princĭpĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>principium</etym>, <sense id="n37239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuance</hi> of a thing after it is begun, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sequel</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque (quidque occeperit), sic ei procedunt postprincipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: voluptas disciplinarum in postprincipiis exsistit, in principiis vero ipsis ineptae et insuaves videntur, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:18:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:9:5" default="NO">16, 9, 5</bibl>: postprincipia atque exitus vitiosae vitae, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl> (Halm reads post principia).</sense></entryFree>
postputo: <entryFree id="n37240" type="main" key="postpu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to regard as secondary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to esteem less</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disregard</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum te postputasse omnes res prae parente intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postquam: <entryFree id="n37241" type="main" key="postquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postquam</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">posquam</orth>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 26</bibl>, acc. to R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verg. A. 3, 463</bibl>; cf. Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1186</bibl>; R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Prol. ad Verg. p. 442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Prol. ad Verg. p. 442</bibl>; also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post quam</orth>), <sense id="n37241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37241.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">After that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when</hi> (class., but rare in Cic., who commonly writes postea quam; v. postea); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperf. indic.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> (v. Zumpt, § 507, b; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 889): abeo ab illis, postquam video, me sic ludificarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam res eorum satis prospera videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 13, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo postquam Caesar pervenit, obsides, arma poposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post quam armis disceptari coeptum est de jure publico, nihil esse actum cum dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam id difficilius visum est neque facultas perficiendi dabatur, transierunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam divitiae honori esse coepere, et eas gloria sequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 70, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undecimo die postquam a te discesseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod post accidisset, quam dedissem ad te liberto litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum post annum, quam redierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">post</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam comedit rem, post rationem putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37241.2" n="II" level="1"> With an accessory idea of cause, <hi rend="ital">since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego illam me velim convenire, postquam inanis sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam poëta sensit, scripturam suam Ab iniquis observari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 1</bibl></cit> (postquam pro quoniam, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam suas terras sedem belli esse viderent, verterunt, etc. (= cum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: sed periit, postquam cerdonibus esse timendus Coeperat; <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nocuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postremitas: <entryFree id="n37242" type="main" key="postre_mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postrēmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>postremus</etym>, <sense id="n37242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postremo: <entryFree id="n37243" type="main" key="postre_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postrēmo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">postrēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. posterus, III. A.</entryFree>
postridie: <entryFree id="n37244" type="main" key="postri_di^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postrīdĭē</orth> (ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">po-strīdŭo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 90</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>loc. form from posterus and die</etym>, <sense id="n37244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the day after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the following</hi> or <hi rend="ital">next day</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dubitavit postridie palam in castris docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā luce postridie constituunt proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie ejus diei mane eādem perfidiā usi Germani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie ejus diei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; 1, 48, 2; 1, 51, 1 et saep.—With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">the day after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatio, quae postridie ludos Apollinaris futura est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: postridie Idus. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 47</bibl>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie Kalendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendas, Nonas, Idus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: absolutionem, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causae fuerit, postridie intellexi, quam a vobis discessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postriduanus: <entryFree id="n37245" type="main" key="postri_du^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postrīdŭānus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">postrīdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>postridie</etym>, <sense id="n37245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comes</hi>, or <pb n="1407" /> <cb n="POST" /> <hi rend="ital">happens on the following day</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postriduo: <entryFree id="n37246" type="main" key="postri_duo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postrīduō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. postridie.</entryFree>
postscaenium: <entryFree id="n37247" type="hapax" key="postscaeni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postscaenĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">poscaenĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cen-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>post-scena</etym>, <sense id="n37247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the part of the theatre behind the scenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the postscenium;</hi> trop., for <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mystery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postscenia vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>those parts of life which are behind the scenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1186</bibl></cit>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
postscribo: <entryFree id="n37248" type="main" key="postscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-scrībo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi> in writing (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberii nomen suo postscripserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postsignani: <entryFree id="n37249" type="main" key="postsigna_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-signāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. milites) [signum], <sense id="n37249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the soldiers who are stationed behind the standards</hi> (opp. antesignani), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:17" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postsum: <entryFree id="n37250" type="main" key="postsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-sum</orth> (also separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">post sum</orth>), <itype>fui, esse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">future;</hi> in tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ignominias sibi post putavit esse prae meo commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>. —<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37250.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postfŭtūri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those yet to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia solus omnium post memoriam humani generis subplicia in post futuros composuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n37250.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">postfŭtūrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the future</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplicare obituri dolorem etiam post futuri aestimatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in post futurum,</quote> <trans><tr>for the future</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum videbitur lex in postfuturum loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postularius: <entryFree id="n37251" type="gloss" key="postu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>postulo</etym>, <sense id="n37251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that demands</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claims</hi>: postularia fulgura, <hi rend="ital">which signify that a forgotten vow must be performed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a neglected sacrifice be offered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl> Müll.; for this is found postulatoria, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 2:49:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 2, 49, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postulaticius: <entryFree id="n37252" type="main" key="postu^la_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">demanded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requested</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postulatio: <entryFree id="n37253" type="main" key="postu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requiring; a demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">postulatio aequa et honesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoscendi,</quote> <trans><tr>a begging pardon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:34:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 34, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedere postulationi alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulationi resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione valentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplications</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro igitur primum omnium fieri obsecrationes, orationes, postulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 118, 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37253.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37253.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expostulation</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque lites ullae inter eas, postulatio Numquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 105</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37253.4" n="B" level="2"> In a court of justice. </sense><sense id="n37253.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an application for redress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulationes ingerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agi per judicis postulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37253.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An application to the prœtor to allow the presentation of a complaint</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37253.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A claim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demand made by a god for a forgotten sacrifice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 31</bibl> MSS. (dub.; B. and K. postilio, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
postulator: <entryFree id="n37254" type="main" key="postu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a claimant</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a plaintiff</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">postulatoribus per libellos respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postulatorius: <entryFree id="n37255" type="main" key="postu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. postularius.</entryFree>
postulatrix: <entryFree id="n37256" type="main" key="postu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>postulator</etym>, <sense id="n37256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that demands</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnitates postulatrices (al. solemnitates, popularitates),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postulatum: <entryFree id="n37257" type="main" key="postu^la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. postulo <sense id="n37257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
postulatus: <entryFree id="n37258" type="hapax" key="postu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>postulo</etym>, <sense id="n37258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a claim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demand</hi> in a court of justice, <hi rend="ital">a suit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum in jus est: postulatu audito, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postulio: <entryFree id="n37259" type="main" key="postu^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. postulatio, II. A.</entryFree>
postulo: <entryFree id="n37260" type="main" key="postu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>posco</etym>, <sense id="n37260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi> (syn.: posco, flagito, peto); constr. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid ab aliquo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquid</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ne</hi>), <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37260.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiunt postulare, poscere, minari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo inventus est tam audax, qui posceret, nemo tam impudens qui postularet ut venderet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>, § 44; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi causa postulat, tamen quia postulat, non flagitat, praeteribo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulabat autem magis quam petebat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc postulo, sive aequom est, te oro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita volo itaque postulo ut fiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; Plaut. <cb n="POST" /> Aul. 4, 10, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">suom jus postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequom postulat, da veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est? num iniquom postulo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hic dies alios mores postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istud, quod postulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:20:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 20, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad senatum venire auxilium postulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberandi sibi unum diem postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem sibi ad deliberandum postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulo abs te, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulatur a te jam diu vel flagitatur potius historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom maxime abs te postulo atque oro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis ab amico postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquid ab amicis postularetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes a me duas postulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod principes civitatum a me postulassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. infra the passages with an object-clause.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ne</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quodam modo postulat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulatum est, ut Bibuli sententia divideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit> (for other examples with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">legatos ad Bocchum mittit postulatum, ne sine causā hostis populo Romano fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">qui postularent, eos qui sibi Galliaeque bellum intulissent, sibi dederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientes homines a senatu de foedere postulaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariovistus legatos ad eum mittit, quod antea de colloquio postulasset, id per se fieri licere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, freq. to be rendered, <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>: qui lepide postulat alterum frustrari, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 7</bibl> (Sat. 32 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic postulat se Romae absolvi, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o facinus impudicum! quam liberam esse oporteat, servire postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ducere istis dictis postulas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lupinum) ne spargi quidem postulat decidens sponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me tibi praemandere postulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—With a double object: quas (sollicitudines) levare tua te prudentia postulat, <hi rend="ital">demands of you</hi>, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>. —With <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui postulat deus credi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37260.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang. </sense><sense id="n37260.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arraign before a court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prosecute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impeach</hi> (syn.: accuso, insimulo); constr. class. usu. with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, post-Aug. also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium tres adhuc factiones postulant: L. Lentulus, qui jam de majestate postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud praetorem de pecuniis repetundis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cornel. Fragm. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem majestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem repetundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit>: aliquem aliquā lege, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex aliquā causā reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem impietatis reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (infames) postulare prohibentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37260.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand a writ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leave to prosecute</hi>, from the prætor or other magistrate: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare est desiderium suum vel amici sui in jure apud eum qui jurisdictioni praeest exponere vel alterius desiderio contradicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">this whole section: De postulando: in aliquem delationem nominis postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare servos in quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37260.5" n="C" level="2"> For the usual expostulare, <hi rend="ital">to complain</hi> of one: <cit><quote lang="la">quom patrem adeas postulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 35</bibl>, the correct read. is expostulare; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—*</sense><sense id="n37260.6" n="D" level="2"> Postulare votum (lit. to ask a desire, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">to vow</hi>, App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37260.7" n="E" level="2"> Of the seller, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi> a price, <hi rend="ital">ask</hi> (post-class. for posco): <cit><quote lang="la">pro eis (libris) trecentos Philippeos postulasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe victori populus quod postulat aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:243" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 243</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37260.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things. </sense><sense id="n37260.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To contain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugerum sex modios seminis postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37260.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cepina magis frequenter subactam postulat terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">po-stŭlātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">po-stŭlāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabilia postulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 12, 28</bibl>: deferre postulata alicujus<cb n="POTE" />  ad aliquem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscere de postulatis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulata facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postumatus: <entryFree id="n37261" type="main" key="postu^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>postumus</etym>, <sense id="n37261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the last</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lowest place</hi> (post-class.), opp. principatus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postumius: <entryFree id="n37262" type="main" key="Postu^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Postŭmĭus</orth> (erroneously writt. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Post-hŭmĭus</orth>; v. postumus, under posterus, III. B.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Postŭmia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n37262.1" n="I" level="1"> Postumius Tubertus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37262.2" n="II" level="1"> Postumia, <hi rend="ital">wife of Sulpicius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37262.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Vestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37262.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A woman addicted to tippling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37262.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Po-stŭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Postumian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 12, 14, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>leading towards Genoa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37262.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Postŭmĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Postumius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Postumian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the dictator A. Postumius Tubertus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of M. Postumius Regillensis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postumo: <entryFree id="n37263" type="main" key="postu^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>postumus</etym>, <sense id="n37263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be inferior</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis consummatio, etsi ordine postumat, effectu tamen anticipat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
postumus: <entryFree id="n37264" type="main" key="postu^mus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">postŭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n37264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, v. posterus, III. B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37265" type="main" key="Postu^mus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Postŭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37265.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Curtius Postumus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the accuser of Murena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 2 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37265.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Rabirius Postumus, <hi rend="ital">defended by Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n37265.3" n="III" level="1"> Ursidius Postumus, <hi rend="ital">to whom is addressed the sixth satire of Juvenal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:38" default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:377" default="NO">377</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postus: <entryFree id="n37266" type="main" key="po_stus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōstus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pono <sense id="n37266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
postveniens: <entryFree id="n37267" type="hapax" key="postve^ni^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">post-vĕnĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [venio], <sense id="n37267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coming after</hi> (opp. praecurrens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postverta: <entryFree id="n37268" type="main" key="Postverta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Post-verta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Post-vorta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n37268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess presiding over childbirth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was invoked when the child made a wrong presentation</hi>: Carmentes, quarum altera Postverta cognominata'st, Prosa altera, a directi perversique partus et potestate et nomine, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:633" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 633</bibl>.—Acc. to Macrobius, <hi rend="ital">a goddess presiding over the future</hi> (opp. Antevorta), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
postvota: <entryFree id="n37269" type="gloss" key="Postvo_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Postvōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Venus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 720</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potabilis: <entryFree id="n37270" type="main" key="po_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potable</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Clar. Urb. 14, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:112" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potaculum: <entryFree id="n37271" type="main" key="po_ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toping</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potamantis: <entryFree id="n37272" type="greek" key="po^ta^mantis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtămantis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Indian plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> thalassegle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potamo: <entryFree id="n37273" type="main" key="Potamo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Potamo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the secretary of the quœstor Cœcilius in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potamogeton:
<entryFree id="n37274" type="greek" key="po^ta^mo^ge_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtămŏgēton</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtămŏgīton</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">potamogei/twn</foreign> (a neighbor of the river), <sense id="n37274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a water-plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water-milfoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pondweed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 33, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:53" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 19, § 53</bibl>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtămŏphylăcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">potamo/s-fulakh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a guarding of the river</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1056, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potatio: <entryFree id="n37275" type="main" key="po_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-bout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">prandium aut potatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: quosdam hesternā ex potatione oscitantes, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurnae potationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potator: <entryFree id="n37276" type="main" key="po_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bibber</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">potatores maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52</bibl></cit>, n. 11; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. vorator),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monogr. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:476" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 476</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potatorius: <entryFree id="n37277" type="main" key="po_ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinking</hi>- (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
potatus: <entryFree id="n37278" type="main" key="po_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potax: <entryFree id="n37279" type="gloss" key="po_tax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fond of drink</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">po/ths</foreign>, bibax, potax Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pote: <entryFree id="n37280" type="main" key="po^te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏte</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. potis, I.</entryFree>
potens: <entryFree id="n37281" type="main" key="po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtens</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. possum <sense id="n37281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="1408" /> <cb n="POTE" /></sense></entryFree>
potentator: <entryFree id="n37282" type="main" key="po^tenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>potens</etym>, <sense id="n37282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potentate</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">solus potentator et rex regnantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 23</bibl></cit> (cf. potens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 15</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
potentatus: <entryFree id="n37283" type="main" key="po^tenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtentātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">might</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37283.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37283.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">political power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (= principatus; so class.): post interitum Tatii cum ad eum potentatus omnis recidisset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de potentatu contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37283.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">a potentate</hi> (late Lat.), <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores et potentatus contemnere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Exh. Mart. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potenter: <entryFree id="n37284" type="main" key="po^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. possum, <sense id="n37284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
potentia: <entryFree id="n37285" type="main" key="po^tenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>potens</etym>, <sense id="n37285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">might</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37285.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote
