lang="la">potestas, opes): armorum tenendorum potentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia solis Acrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:537" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulti miranda potentia fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37285.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictamni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia achatae contra scorpiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37285.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37285.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faculty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">supra humanam potentiam magnitudine animi praeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37285.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Political power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">potentia est ad sua conservanda et alterius obtinenda idonearum rerum facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam divitiae honori esse coeperunt, et eas gloria, imperium, potentia sequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant in magnā potentiā, qui consulebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were in great authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiam alicujus criminari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis,</quote> <trans><tr>the rule of an individual</tr>, <tr>monarchical power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>supreme dominion</tr>, <tr>sovereignty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 259</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra periculosissimas hominum potentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37285.6" n="III" level="1"> In <case>abl.</case>: potentiā, <hi rend="ital">virtually</hi>, Boethius, Analyt. Post. 1, 24.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37286" type="main" key="Po^tenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n37286.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Maria di Potenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:28:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 28, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37286.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Potentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 123" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 123</bibl></cit> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n37286.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Lucania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Potenza;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Potentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lucania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potentialiter: <entryFree id="n37287" type="main" key="po^tenti^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtentĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>potentia</etym>, <sense id="n37287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mightily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potentini: <entryFree id="n37288" type="main" key="Po^tenti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Potentia, B.</entryFree>
poterion: <entryFree id="n37289" type="main" key="po^te_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtērĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n37289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> phrynion, perh. <hi rend="ital">tragacanth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 76, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:122" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 97, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
poterium: <entryFree id="n37290" type="greek" key="po^te_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n37290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goblet</hi> (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potesse: <entryFree id="n37291" type="main" key="po^tesse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtesse</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtessim</orth>, v. possum <sense id="n37291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
potestas: <entryFree id="n37292" type="main" key="po^testas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtestas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n37292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> potestatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 20, § 67</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>possum</etym>. </sense><sense id="n37292.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> of doing any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">SI FVRIOSVS EST AGNATORVM GENTILIVMQVE IN EO PECVNIAQVE EIVS POTESTAS ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tabularum: vim tantam in se et potestatem habere tantae astutiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to have such a power of craftiness</tr>, <tr>to be able to devise such tricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut potestas defuit aut facultas aut voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere potestatem vitae necisque in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:29:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 29, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem alicui deferre beneficiorum tribuendorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 16, 37</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas occurrere telis ... ensem avellere dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:296" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.2" n="B" level="2"> In phrases. </sense><sense id="n37292.3" n="1" level="3"> Esse in potestate alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to be in one's power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under one's control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be subject to</hi> (for a description of the relation of potestas under the Roman law, and of the classes of persons to whom it applied, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:49" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 49</bibl> sqq.): <cit><quote lang="la">mittuntur legati, qui nuntient, ut sit in senatūs populique Romani potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in dicione ac potestate alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: habere familiam in potestate, <hi rend="ital">to keep them slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to</hi> <cb n="POTE" /> <hi rend="ital">free them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.4" n="2" level="3"> Esse in suā potestate, <hi rend="ital">to be one's own master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">esse suae potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.5" n="3" level="3"> Jus potestatemque habere imperandi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consulis eā de re jus ac potestatem esse dixisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had jurisdiction and authority over it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37292.6" n="4" level="3"> Est mea (tua, etc.) potestas, <hi rend="ital">I have the power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I can</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 42</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed volui meam potestatem esse vel petendi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37292.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Political power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium, dicio): Thessaliam in potestatem Thebanorum redigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 31</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sub potestatem Atheniensium redigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in potestate alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere aliquem in suā potestate ac dicione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">97: venire in arbitrium ac potestatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>, § 150.—</sense><sense id="n37292.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Magisterial power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magistracy</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus, auctoritas): potestas praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui togatus in re publicā cum potestate imperioque versatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ut bonā ratione emerit, nihil pro potestate, nihil ab invito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum potestate aut legatione in provinciam proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>, § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 27, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores dederunt operam, ut ita potestatem gererent, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>so to administer the office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 14</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia, potestates, legationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in potestatibus gerendis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37292.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37292.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A person in office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public officer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magistrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a magistratu aut ab aliquā potestate legitimā evocatus,</quote> <trans><tr>by some lawful authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mavis Fidenarum esse potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supreme monarch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum rerumque aeterna potestas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod credere de se Non possit, cum laudatur dis aequa potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 71</bibl></cit> (v. context): potestates, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxai/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the highest magistrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsae potestates,</quote> <trans><tr>officers of state</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictionem potestatibus per provincias demandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.13" n="C" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">legal power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi> over or to a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">potestatis verbo plura significantur: in personā magistratuum imperium, in personā liberorum patria potestas, in personā servi dominium: at cum agimus de noxae deditione cum eo, qui servum non defendit, praesentis corporis copiam facultatemque significamus. Ex lege Atiniā in potestatem domini rem furtivam venisse videri, et si ejus vindicandae potestatem habuerit, Sabinus et Cassius aiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:215" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 215</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.14" n="D" level="2"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">operation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestates colorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestates visque herbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniarum,</quote> <trans><tr>value</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec potestatibus praesentibus dijudicanda sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>circumstances</tr>, <tr>state of things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionum vis et potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaternarius numerus suis partibus complet decadis ipsius potestatem (because the first four integers, taken together, = 10),</quote> <trans><tr>compass</tr>, <tr>fulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi potestas,</quote> <trans><tr>nature</tr>, <tr>quality</tr>, <tr>properties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.15" n="E" level="2"> Of a word, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis, significatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.16" n="F" level="1"> Math. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">du/namis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the square root</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.17" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37292.18" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (class.): dum ex tanto gaudio in potestatem nostram redeamus, <hi rend="ital">recover our self-control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to ourselves</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exisse ex potestate dicimus eos, qui effrenati feruntur aut libidine, aut iracundiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to have lost the control of their reason</tr>, <tr>to be out of their minds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui exisse ex potestate dicuntur, idcirco dicuntur, quia non sunt in potestate mentis, cui regnum totius animi a natura tributum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ad te cum omnium rerum tum etiam tui potestatem di transtulerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.19" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copia, facultas): ubi mihi potestas primum evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberius vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum potestas data est augendae dignitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: quoties mihi certorum hominum potestas erit (al. facultas),<cb n="POTI" />  <hi rend="ital">whenever I find men on whom I can rely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 1</bibl>: facere potestatem, <hi rend="ital">to give opportunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid de his rebus dicere vellet, feci potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae potestas si mihi saepius fiet, utar,</quote> <trans><tr>shall present itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui potestatem optionemque facere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facio tibi interpellandi potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego instare, omnium mihi tabularum et litterarum fieri potestatem oportere,</quote> <trans><tr>must be allowed the use of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl></cit>: potestatem sui facere, <hi rend="ital">to allow others to see</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have access to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give an opportunity of conversing with one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum neque praetores diebus aliquot adiri possent vel potestatem sui facerent,</quote> <trans><tr>allowed themselves to be spoken to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere omnibus conveniendi sui potestatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to admit to an audience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui potestatem sui non habuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>who had not been able to speak with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem sui facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give an opportunity of fighting with one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fugis hinc praeceps, dum praecipitare potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc flere potestas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli cui tanta potestas meis occurrere telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:296" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 296</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.20" n="IV" level="1"> In eccl. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">potestates,</quote> <trans><tr>angels</tr>, <tr>angelic powers</tr>, <tr>authorities in the spiritual world</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ephes. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 3, 22; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37292.21" n="V" level="1"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Pallas and Styx</hi>, Hyg. Fab. prooem.</sense></entryFree>
potestativus: <entryFree id="n37293" type="main" key="po^testa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtestātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>potestas</etym>, <sense id="n37293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">denoting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing power</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">principatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potestur: <entryFree id="n37294" type="main" key="po^testur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtestur</orth>, v. possum <sense id="n37294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pothinus: <entryFree id="n37295" type="main" key="Po^thi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏthīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the assassin of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">112</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pothos: <entryFree id="n37296" type="greek" key="po^thos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/qos</foreign> (desire). <sense id="n37296.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A summer flower</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37296.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated statue of Scopas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potica: <entryFree id="n37297" type="main" key="Po_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōtĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of drinking among children</hi>, Don. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 15</bibl>; v. Potina.</sense></entryFree>
potidaea: <entryFree id="n37298" type="main" key="Po^ti^daea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtĭdaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*potidai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n37298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Pallene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called Cassandrea</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Pinaka</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 58, 59, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
potidania: <entryFree id="n37299" type="main" key="Po^ti^da_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtĭdānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*potidani/a</foreign>, <sense id="n37299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potilis: <entryFree id="n37300" type="main" key="po_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that pertains to drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinking</hi>- (ante- and post-class.): potilis nidus, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 145, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptus,</quote> <trans><tr>a drawing in when drinking</tr>, <tr>sipping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërem recipere atque reddere haustu potili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:8:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potin: <entryFree id="n37301" type="main" key="po^ti^n'"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭn'</orth> <itype>is used</itype>, <sense id="n37301.0" n="I" level="1"> For potisne: <cit><quote lang="la">potin' es? i. e. potes?</quote> <trans><tr>can you? are you able?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37301.1" n="II" level="1"> For potisne est? i. e. potest? potin' ut desinas? <hi rend="ital">can you leave off?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">pray leave off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potin' ut taceas?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be silent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potina: <entryFree id="n37302" type="main" key="Po_ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōtīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭca</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over children's drinking</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 19</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potio: <entryFree id="n37303" type="main" key="po_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, abstr. and concr. (class.). </sense><sense id="n37303.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n37303.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediā potione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptissimis escis et potionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37303.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cibo et potione fames sitisque depulsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo cibo et potione completi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus et potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">A POTIONE,</quote> <trans><tr>a cup-bearer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 578, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37303.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37303.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A poisonous draught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potione mulierem sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: potio mortis causa data. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 350" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 350</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec potio torquet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:624" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 624</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37303.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A draught</hi> or <hi rend="ital">potion</hi> given by physicians: <cit><quote lang="la">dare potionis aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiones ad id efficaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37303.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A magic potion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:73" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37303.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: nam mihi jam intus potione juncea onerabo gulam, <hi rend="ital">load my throat with a draught of rushes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hang myself with a rope of rushes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37304" type="main" key="po^ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>potis</etym>, <sense id="n37304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put into the power of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subject to</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">eum nunc potivit pater Servitutis,</quote> <trans><tr>made a slave of him</tr>, <tr>reduced him to slavery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: potitu'st hostium, <hi rend="ital">fallen into the</hi> <pb n="1409" /> <cb n="POTI" /> <hi rend="ital">enemy's hands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 104</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 35</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
potionarius: <entryFree id="n37305" type="gloss" key="po_ti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. potio</etym>, <sense id="n37305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to drinking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a drink</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potiono: <entryFree id="n37306" type="main" key="po_ti^o_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭōno</orth>, no <sense id="n37306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give to drink</hi> (in the verb. <hi rend="ital">finit.</hi> post class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jumentum potione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; 3, 59: omnes gentes, Hieron. in Isa. 8, 27, v. 2.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that has had a potion given him</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">potionatus amatorio medicamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potior: <entryFree id="n37307" type="main" key="po^ti^or1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype> (<sense id="n37307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> potirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 66</bibl>.—Acc. to the third conj., potĭtur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=274" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 274</bibl> Müll. or Ann. v. 78 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capto potĭmur mundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 882</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 402</bibl>.—Potītur. only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 881</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 113</bibl>. So, poti for potiri, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 29</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl>, acc. to Trag. Rel. p. 56 Rib., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 260" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 260</bibl> Vahl.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭo</orth>, īre; v. 2. potio), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [potis]. </sense><sense id="n37307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>acc.</case>, <case>abl.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class.; syn.: occupo, invado). </sense><sense id="n37307.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius regni potiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis potiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemini in opinionem veniebat Antonium rerum potiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:331" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 331</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37307.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (mostly ante- and post-class.; not in Cic.): regnum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 481, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 30" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus sceptra potitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1038</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum, Auct. B. Hisp. 13: summum imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>to get possession of the supreme dominion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regni Persarum potiundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes urbis potiundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spe urbis hostium potiundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37307.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille hodie si illā sit potitus muliere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura iis potiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad decem milia annorum gentem aliquam urbe nostra potituram putem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 90</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio totius Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentis castrisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 113</bibl></cit>: pane, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 881</bibl> P.: thalamo, Naev. ib.—</sense><sense id="n37307.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines ad potiundum incitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiendi spe inflammati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37307.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>acc.</case>, <case>abl.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class.; syn.: fruor, utor). </sense><sense id="n37307.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleanthes solem dominari et rerum potiri putat,</quote> <trans><tr>has the chief power in the universe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas Atheniensium, dum ea rerum potita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiente rerum patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37307.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem hunc potiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria potitur commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37307.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui iis (voluptatibus), quibus senectus, etiam si non abunde potitur, non omnino caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monte,</quote> <trans><tr>have climbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37307.10" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tenent, qui potiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37309" type="main" key="po^ti^or2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭor</orth>, <itype>ĭus</itype>, <sense id="n37309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> of potis.</sense></entryFree>
potitus: <entryFree id="n37308" type="main" key="po^ti_tus1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, in a <sense id="n37308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., v. 2. potio.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n37316" type="main" key="po^ti_tus2" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. potior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37317" type="main" key="Potitus3" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Potitus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Valerius Potitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potis: <entryFree id="n37310" type="main" key="po^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtis</orth> (in the positive rarely declined, and in the <sense id="n37310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏte</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏ-tĭor</orth>, ius; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissĭmus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; class. only in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>) [Sanscr. patis, lord; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">po/sis</foreign>, husband; <foreign lang="greek">des-po/ths</foreign>, lord; Lat. compotis (compos) potiri]. </sense><sense id="n37310.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capable; possible</hi> (mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): divi qui potes pro illo quod Samothraces <foreign lang="greek">qeoi\ dunatoi/</foreign>, Varr L. L. 5, § 58 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi qui colaphos perpeti Potis parasitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Usually in the connection potis or pote est, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">it is able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">may</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">can</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ea supterfugere potis es pauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: neque sanguis ullo potis est pacto profluens consistere, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl>: istam non potis est vis saeva exstinguere venti, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at non Evandrum potis est vis ulla tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunquam potis est sejungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potis est cerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 719</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui potis est?</quote> <trans><tr>how is it possible?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:72:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 72, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <number>plur.</number>: si speres quicquam prodesse potis sunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> Müll. <cb n="POTI" /> (Ann. v. 410 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">duae plus satis dare potis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pastores potis sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">est</hi>: quis potis ingentes oras evolvere belli? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 381</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 178 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 671</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 13</bibl>.—Form pote: <cit><quote lang="la">si non aliud pote est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 43, 16</bibl></cit>. Without <hi rend="ital">est</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec devitari letum pote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1079" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1079</bibl></cit>: viget, veget, utpote plurimum, Varr. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 876</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non emptor pote ex empto vendito illum damnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eniti remis pote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:680" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 680</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pote? vis dicam? nugaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:56" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te dici pote, Id, quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:98:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 98, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec peccatum a me quisquam pote dicere quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 67, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc facito, sive id non pote sive pote,</quote> <trans><tr>be it impossible or possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 76, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pote simplicius?</quote> <trans><tr>what can be more simple?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil pote supra,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing could exceed it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 38, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum pote,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: quam pote, <hi rend="ital">as much as possible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aufugiamus istinc quam pote longissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 119, 33.—</sense><sense id="n37310.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <hi rend="ital">that may be preferred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferred; better</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37310.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam edepol erit ille potior Harpax, quam ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem aequiust potiorem habere quam te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: qui plus pollet potiorque est patre, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque cives potiores quam peregrini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sosim et Moericum quibus tantam crederem rem, potiores habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu, qui potior nunc es,</quote> <trans><tr>happier in love</tr>, <tr>preferred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 33</bibl></cit> (5, 69): <cit><quote lang="la">ut in judicio possessionis potior esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37310.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">better</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stronger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more useful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">important</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla potior serenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 43, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novistine locum potiorem rure beato?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors civibus Romanis semper fuit servitute potior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi turpis vita integrā famā potior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi potius fuit quam ut Massinissam convenirem,</quote> <trans><tr>I had nothing more important</tr>, <tr>nothing more urgent to do</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa semper potiora duxisti, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper se rei publicae commoda privatis necessitatibus habuisse potiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut probetis potiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: hem, mater mea, tibi rem potiorem video (sc. verbis), <hi rend="ital">I see a fact stronger than words</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a clearer proof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37310.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most important.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37310.6" n="A" level="2"> Of persons (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">item huic ultro fit, ut Meret, potissimus nostrae domi ut sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis potissimus umbris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:627" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potissimos libertorum veneno interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37310.7" n="B" level="2"> Of things (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum potius, aut quid potissimum sit, quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, only in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37310.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more</hi> (class.; cf.: satius, prius): quo nos vocabis nomine? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Libortos. <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Non patronos? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Id potius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed scin', quid volo potius, sodes, facias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero imperia expetenda: ac potius non accipienda interdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam potius esse Ariovisti quam populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—When the predicates are compared, the verb in the following clause is always in the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpessus est omnia potius quam conscios indicaret,</quote> <trans><tr>rather than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratione non vis potius quam delectatio postulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privabo potius illum debito testimonio quam id cum meā laude communicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribam aliquid potius, quam committam ut litterae non reddantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos potius nostro delicto plectemur, quam res publica nostra peccata luat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per interregem comitia habenda potius, quam consulum alter a bello avocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 14, 16</bibl>.— So with <hi rend="ital">quam ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se miliens morituros potius quam ut tantum dedecoris admitti patiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: audeo dicere hoc malo <cb n="POTO" /> domitos ipsos potius cultores agrorum fore, quam ut armati, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 34, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 14, 7</bibl>.—But after verbs of willing, wishing (sometimes of declaring), the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> is used: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatore obstinato tollere potius totum e re publicā consulatum, quam promiscuum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 13, 8</bibl>: v. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl>; Fest. s. v. olivitam, p. 202 Müll.; v. Muuml;ll. ad. loc. p. 203, a. —In an inverted order: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 5</bibl></cit>: quid mihi negotii est eum istis nugacibus, quam potius potamus mulsum? C. Titius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>.—Sometimes potius is to be supplied: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita, bona est mulier semper, quam loquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen statuit congredi, quam cum tantis copiis refugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Pleon., with words which already express comparison.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Uticae potius quam Romae esse malle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorabiliores rei potius, quam actores habentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:167" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37310.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., introducing a repetition of a thought in a corrected or strengthened form: aut potius, vel potius, <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or I may better say</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiet enim ratio ut ... mors aut malum non sit, aut sit bonum potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam fuit imbecillus P. Africani filius, quam tenui aut nullā potius valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erravit aut potius insanivit Apronius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato magnus hercule homo, vel potius summus et singularis vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37310.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissŭ-</orth>), and more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissĭmum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissŭ-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in preference to all others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most of all</hi> (class.).—Form potissime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl>.—Form potissimum: <cit><quote lang="la">responde, quo leto censes me ut peream potissimum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsistat aliquis et potissimum Caecus ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos id potissimum consecuti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta erat contentio, qui potissimum ex magno numero conscenderent, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agam? aut quo potissimum infelix accedam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potissime: <entryFree id="n37311" type="main" key="po^tissi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissŭmē</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtis-sĭmum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissŭmum</orth>), <sense id="n37311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. potis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
potissum: <entryFree id="n37312" type="main" key="po^tissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtissum</orth>, v. possum <sense id="n37312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
potitius: <entryFree id="n37313" type="main" key="Po^ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtītĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n37313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n37313.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Potitian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Potitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37313.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Potitius auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 269</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏtītĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">priests of Hercules</hi>, v. Pinarius.</sense></entryFree>
potito: <entryFree id="n37314" type="main" key="po_ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink often</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">patera aurea, Qui Pterela potitare solitus est rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potitor: <entryFree id="n37315" type="main" key="po^ti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. potior</etym>, <sense id="n37315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Capuae potitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potiuncula: <entryFree id="n37318" type="main" key="po_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. potio</etym>, <sense id="n37318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small draught</hi> or <hi rend="ital">potion</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">modica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potius: <entryFree id="n37319" type="main" key="po^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏtĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. potis <sense id="n37319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
potniae: <entryFree id="n37320" type="main" key="Potni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Potnĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*potniai/</foreign>, <sense id="n37320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Asopus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in whose neighborhood were pastures which made animals mad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37320.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pot-nĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*potnia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Potniœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Potnian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quo tempore Glauci Potniades malis membra absumpsere quadrigae (i. e. equae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 268</bibl></cit>: equae, Ov. lb. 557.</sense></entryFree>
poto: <entryFree id="n37321" type="main" key="po_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, or pōtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root po; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/nw, pe/pwka</foreign>, to drink; Lat. potus, potor, poculum, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n37321.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.; syn. bibo), Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 5, 7, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut edormiscam hanc crapulam, quam potavi,</quote> <trans><tr>this intoxication which I have drunk myself into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37321.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37321.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37321.3" n="a" level="4"> Potare flumen aliquod, <hi rend="ital">to drink from a stream</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to dwell by it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera, quae gelidum potat Araxen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 57" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna Tagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 286</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37321.4" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. subjects, <pb n="1410" /> <cb n="POTU" /> <hi rend="ital">to drink up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to absorb</hi> moisture (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis sudorem potat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potantia vellera fucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potanda ferens infantibus ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37321.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Causative</hi> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to give to drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to drink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potasti nos vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potaverunt me aceto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:49:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 49, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 14, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37321.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37321.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">redi simul mecum potatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potaturus est apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si potare velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>: potare dilutius, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potum veniunt juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: cornibus, <hi rend="ital">from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out of horns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 126</bibl>.—<mood>Part.</mood>: potatus, <hi rend="ital">caused to drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished with drink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">felle et aceto potatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et omnes in spiritu potati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37321.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tipple</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsonat, potat, olet unguenta de meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi primum insuevit exercitus populi Romani amare, potare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui voluptate potandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totos dies potabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potantibus his apud Sex.
