Tarquinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 6 al.</bibl></cit>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37321.9" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has drunk</hi>: et pransus sum, et potus sum, dicamus, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 7</bibl>; but usually, <hi rend="ital">drunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">domum bene potus redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitia pransi, poti, oscitantis ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 90</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37321.10" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has been drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drained</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine tauri poto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poti faece tenus cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amygdalae ex aquā potae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potor: <entryFree id="n37322" type="main" key="po_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinker.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37322.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aquae potores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37322.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanique potor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the dweller by the Rhone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37322.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a hard drinker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drunkard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tippler</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">potorum rixae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potores bibuli Falerni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:78:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 78, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 50, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:263" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 23, 99, § 263</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potorius: <entryFree id="n37323" type="main" key="po_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>potor</etym>, <sense id="n37323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinking</hi>- (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">potoria vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>silver drinking-vessels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: sil, i. e. liquidum, Pelag. Veter. 21: PRAEPOSITVS AVRI POTORII, <hi rend="ital">superintendent of the golden drinking-vessels</hi>, an officer at court, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1111, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">AB ARGENTO POTORIO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 582, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 895, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37323.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goblet</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">potoria gemmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potrix: <entryFree id="n37324" type="main" key="po_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female tippler</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potua: <entryFree id="n37325" type="main" key="Po_tu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pōtŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>poto</etym>, <sense id="n37325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of drinking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Victa et Potua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
potulanus: <entryFree id="n37326" type="main" key="Potula_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Potulānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Potulan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of Sicilian wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8</bibl></cit> § 66.</sense></entryFree>
potulentus: <entryFree id="n37327" type="main" key="po_tu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pōcŭl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>potus</etym>. <sense id="n37327.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinkable</hi> (rare but class.).—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtŭlen-ta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">drinkables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus habitat in eā parte oris, quā esculentis et potulentis iter natura patefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esculenta omnia et potulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Q. Scaevola ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37327.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Drunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 131, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
potus: <entryFree id="n37328" type="main" key="po_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from poto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37329" type="main" key="po_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. poto</etym>, <sense id="n37329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37329.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37329.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immoderato extumefacta potu atque pastu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum quod potui datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">date potui aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentorum potus stomacho inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potum exiguum equis impertiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 42, 65, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta in potus addunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 3, 5, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei potu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus potusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 66, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 5, 10, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37329.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tippling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toping</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in potu atque bilaritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 12</bibl></cit>: immenso potu <cb n="PRAE" /> impleri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37329.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">urine</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37329.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A drinking-cup</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Fortunat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:S. Rhad. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> S. Rhad. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37329.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beverage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vini similitudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
practicus: <entryFree id="n37330" type="greek" key="practi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">practĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">praktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n37330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">active</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prae: <entryFree id="n37331" type="main" key="prae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, and <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>abl.</case> [for prai, kindred with Sanscr. prefix pra-, before; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pro/, pri/n, pro/sw</foreign>; cf.: pro, prior, porro, primus]. <sense id="n37331.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37331.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">abi prae, Sosia, Jam ego sequar,</quote> <trans><tr>go before</tr>, <tr>go in advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i prae, sequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 69</bibl>: i tu prae, virgo; <cit><quote lang="la">non queo, quod pone me est, servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age nunc tu, i prae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37331.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as a particle of comparison, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quod</hi> (also written in one word, praeut and praequam; cf. Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 503</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">in comparison with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compared with</hi> (ante- and post-class. and colloq.): <cit><quote lang="la">parum etiam, praeut futurum est praedicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo noster nunc quidem est de verbis, prae ut dudum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil hercle quidem hoc, Prae ut alia dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludum dices fuisse, praeut hujus rabies quae dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' parva res est voluptatum in vitā atque in aetate agundā, praequam quod molestum'st?</quote> <trans><tr>in comparison with the trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil hoc est, triginta minae, prae quam alios dapsilis sumptus facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 62</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam minoris omnia facio prae quam quibus modis Me ludificatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc etiam pulcrum'st praequam sumptus ubi petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. prol. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae etsi longioribus verbis comprehensa est praequam illud Graecum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo res omnis relictas habeo prae quod tu velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37331.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>abl.</case> (with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae cornua, prae litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">46, 1</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in advance of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37331.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum erit, ut (villa) a tergo potius quam prae se flumen habeat,</quote> <trans><tr>before it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: limina alia prae aliis erant, App. de Mundo, p. 69, 22.—Esp. freq.: prae se ferre, agere, mittere, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">send before one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille qui stillantem prae se pugionem tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti prae se in aerarium tulit quattuordecim milia pondo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se ferens Darium puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se armentum agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos prae se inermes mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 2</bibl></cit>: prae manu, and, less freq., prae manibus, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on hand</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">patri reddidi omne aurum, quod fuit prae manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prae manu debitor (pecuniam) non haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Caesaris liber prae manibus est, promi jubeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes si forte prae manu non fuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37331.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37331.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: prae se ferre, less freq., prae se gerere, declarare, etc., prop. to carry before one's self. as if to show it; hence, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi> (freq. and class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse ceteri tectiores: ego semper me didicisse, prae me tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero cum venit, prae se fert, aut qui sit aut unde veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus et facinus prae se ferens et confitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris prae se fert et ostentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beata vita glorianda et praedicanda et prae se ferenda est: nihil est enim aliud quod praedicandum et prae se ferendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 50</bibl></cit>: conjecturam prae se gerere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum altum et erectum prae se gerebat, Auct. B. Afr. 10: prae se declarant gaudia vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se maximam speciem ostentare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 342, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37331.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in comparisons, <hi rend="ital">in comparison with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compared with</hi> (mostly in comparisons which imply a contrast of kind; while praeter refers to a contrast of degree only: dives prae ceteris, in contrast with the others, who are poor: dives praeter ceteros, richer than the other rich ones; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 894). </sense><sense id="n37331.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">positive adj.</hi> (class.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia prae meo commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: omnium unguentum odor prae tuo nautea est, Plaut. <cb n="PRAE" /> Curc. 1, 2, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallis prae magnitudine corporum suorum brevitas nostra contemptui est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae divitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbant omnes prae illo parvi futuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veros illos Atticos prae se paene agrestes putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab isto prae lucro praedāque nec vectigalium nec posteritatis habitam esse rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu quidem vacuus molestiis, sed prae nobis beatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(stultitia) prae ceteris parit immensas cupiditates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37331.9" n="(b)" level="5"> So with <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> for quam (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">atque me minoris facio prae illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id prae illo, quod honestum nobis est, fit plenius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 44, 3</bibl>; Aug. c. Acad. 1, 22.—</sense><sense id="n37331.10" n="3" level="3"> In giving the cause, which, as it were, goes before, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by reason of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi> (class. only of a hinderance; with an express or implied negation; or with <hi rend="ital">vix</hi>, v. Zumpt, § 310): Ulixi cor frixit prae pavore, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae laetitiā lacrumae praesiliunt mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae lassitudine opus est ut lavem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae gaudio ubi sim nescio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere non quit Prae macie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec loqui prae maerore potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum ille nomen prae metu ferre non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem prae jaculorum multitudine non videbitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix sibimet ipsi prae nec opinato gaudio credentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49</bibl></cit>.—In composition, prae usually denotes, </sense><sense id="n37331.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Before</hi>: praedico, praebibo, praecaveo, etc.; so too, praeceps, <hi rend="ital">headforemost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headlong.</hi>—In time: praecanus, <hi rend="ital">gray before one's time.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37331.12" n="b" level="4"> Enhancing the main idea, qs. in advance of others: praealtus, <hi rend="ital">extremely high</hi>: praeclarus, <hi rend="ital">very celebrated;</hi> praevalidus, <hi rend="ital">very strong</hi>, etc.</sense></entryFree>
praeaccipio: <entryFree id="n37332" type="main" key="praeacci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeaccĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to admit antecedently</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">miraculis praeacceptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 105, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeacuo: <entryFree id="n37333" type="main" key="praea^cu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ăcŭo</orth>, <itype>ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sharpen before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at one end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen to a point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculum praeacuito ... eum primorem praeacuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit> and 3.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeăcūtus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n37333.1" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood>—</sense><sense id="n37333.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sharpened before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculus aridus praeacutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna paulum ab imo praeacuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeăcūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very acutely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeaequo: <entryFree id="n37334" type="gloss" key="praeaequo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-aequo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make equal before</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praealte: <entryFree id="n37335" type="main" key="praealte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praealtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praealtus <sense id="n37335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praealtus: <entryFree id="n37336" type="main" key="praealtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-altus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). <sense id="n37336.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Verg high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praealtae rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum, Auct. B. Afr. 37, 3: volatus volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni praealtius omnibus sidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 886</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37336.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium fluminis praealti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima terrae praealta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praealtissimus puteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 365</bibl></cit> Oud.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praealtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very deeply</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">trabes in terram praealte defigitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeambulo: <entryFree id="n37337" type="main" key="praeambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to walk before</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 905</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeambulus: <entryFree id="n37338" type="main" key="praeambu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeambŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prae-ambulo</etym>, <sense id="n37338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">walking before</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 215</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matre praeambulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, § 996</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeaudio: <entryFree id="n37339" type="main" key="praeaudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-audĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hear beforehand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 14</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae -audītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">heard before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examined before</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">custodiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praebenda: <entryFree id="n37340" type="main" key="praebenda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebenda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praebeo</etym>, <sense id="n37340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the support</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allowance afforded by the State to a private person</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praebeo: <entryFree id="n37341" type="main" key="praebe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum</itype> (old <sense id="n37341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> praeberier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 2, 7</bibl>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. from praehibeo, q. v. from prae-habeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to hold forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. signif.; syn.: ministro, suppedito, suggero). </sense><sense id="n37341.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis parvulo praebens ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum de manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: collum cultris, Juv <pb n="1411" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> 10, 269: <cit><quote lang="la">praebenda gladio cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:345" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 973" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 973</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os ad contumeliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to give ear</tr>, <tr>listen</tr>, <tr>attend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 52</bibl></cit>; Vulg.Sap. 6, 3: aurem, id. Job, 6, 28.—</sense><sense id="n37341.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum, vestem, purpuram Bene praebeo, nec quicquam eges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: vicem, <hi rend="ital">to supply the place of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem postium,</quote> <trans><tr>to supply the place of posts</tr>, <tr>serve as posts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37341.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion; to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent;</hi> and with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behave one's self</hi> in a certain manner: <cit><quote lang="la">operam reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam seditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 4, 5, § 19</bibl></cit> (al. perhibuit): <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicui in periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp. with <hi rend="ital">se</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">se talem alicui, qualem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re misericordem et in testimonio religiosum se praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius se auctorem meae salutis praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo vehementer se moderatum praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in malis hominem praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se dignum suis majoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eos, qui ea perficere voluerunt, me severum vehementemque praebeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me similem in utroque praebui,</quote> <trans><tr>towards both</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <case>nom.</case> of <pos>adj.</pos> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis videtur, praebebit se periculis fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 26</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari se virtute praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo magistratu pari diligentiā se Hannibal praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—So, also, without <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phormio in hac re ut aliis strenuum hominem praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; so, too, in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> signif. of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to surrender herself</hi> to her lover: <cit><quote lang="la">odi quae praebet, quia sit praebere necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere se legibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to resign one's self to</tr>, <tr>submit to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere causam tollendi indutias,</quote> <trans><tr>to give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem insidiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem impunitatis aut locum peccandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium et metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput argutae historiae,</quote> <trans><tr>matter for an entertaining story</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 20, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish sport</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let</hi> a thing be done (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae toties rapta est, praebuit ipsa rapi,</quote> <trans><tr>suffered herself to be carried off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 132</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">what is furnished</hi> for support, <hi rend="ital">allowance</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">annua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebitis annuis privavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praebia: <entryFree id="n37342" type="gloss" key="praebi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praebeo</etym>, <sense id="n37342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an amulet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebia a praebendo ut sit tutus, quod sint remedia in collo pueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl></cit> Müll.: praebia, remedia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=235" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 235</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">fulakth/rion</foreign>, servatorium, amolimentum, amuletum, praebia, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
praebibo: <entryFree id="n37343" type="main" key="praebi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>bĭbi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink to</hi> one (rare but class.): ei cui venenum praebiberat (= propinaverat), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabimus aquam praebibendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">propi/nw</foreign>, propino, probibo (leg. praebibo), Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
praebita: <entryFree id="n37344" type="main" key="praebi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. praebeo <sense id="n37344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praebitio: <entryFree id="n37345" type="main" key="praebi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praebeo</etym>, <sense id="n37345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnishing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37345.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (ante-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37345.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a supplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providing</hi> for the use of the State (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gravari copiarum praebitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventitiae olei frumentique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 41:19" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 41, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praebitor: <entryFree id="n37346" type="main" key="praebi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. In gen., <sense id="n37346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplier</hi> (rare but class.): usitati muneris, Ambros. Job et Dav. 2, 5, 20.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n37346.1" n="1" level="3"> Minister et praebitor, <hi rend="ital">who provided support for the officers of the government visiting the province</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37346.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A purveyor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contractor</hi> for government, Inscr. Giorn. Arcad. t. 24, p. 82.</sense></entryFree>
praebitus: <entryFree id="n37347" type="main" key="praebi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praebĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praebeo.</entryFree>
praecadens: <entryFree id="n37348" type="main" key="praeca^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cădens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [cado], <sense id="n37348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falling forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pollex praecadens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praecaeco: <entryFree id="n37349" type="main" key="praecaeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-caeco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blind beforehand</hi>, Ven. Fort. v. Ger. 33.</sense></entryFree>
praecaedo: <entryFree id="n37350" type="main" key="praecaedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-caedo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. praecido <sense id="n37350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecalefactus: <entryFree id="n37351" type="main" key="praeca^le^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-călĕfactus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cal-factus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [calefacio], <sense id="n37351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warmed very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">prae-calefacta apponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:17:169" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 17, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 156" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera praecalfacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecalidus: <entryFree id="n37352" type="main" key="praeca^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-călĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: sanguis, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:320" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 320</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecalvus: <entryFree id="n37353" type="main" key="praecalvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-calvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very bald</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecandidus: <entryFree id="n37354" type="main" key="praecandi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-candĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very white</hi> (very rare): margarita (al. percandida), Maecen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecano: <entryFree id="n37355" type="main" key="praeca^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-căno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n37355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> praececini), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37355.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for the class. praecino),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Genethl. 10</bibl> (al. praecinebant; v. praecino, II.).—* </sense><sense id="n37355.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To anticipate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy in advance the power of an enchantment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aiunt (viperam) praecanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 21, § 69</bibl></cit> dub. (perh. recanere, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
praecantatio: <entryFree id="n37356" type="main" key="praecanta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecanto</etym>, <sense id="n37356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchantment</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joann. 7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joann. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 19:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 9</bibl>; Pelag. Vet. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecantator: <entryFree id="n37357" type="main" key="praecanta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecantātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchanter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorcerer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joann. 7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joann. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praecantatrix: <entryFree id="n37358" type="spur" key="praecanta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecantātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis, a false reading for praecantrix</itype>, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 127:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 127, 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
praecanto: <entryFree id="n37359" type="main" key="praecanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-canto</orth>, no <sense id="n37359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37359.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (ante-class.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 102, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37359.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To enchant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewitch</hi> (postAug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl>, v. praecento.</sense></entryFree>
praecantor: <entryFree id="n37360" type="main" key="praecantor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecantor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praecano</etym>, <sense id="n37360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchanter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 127:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 127, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecantrix: <entryFree id="n37361" type="main" key="praecantrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecantrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecantor</etym>, <sense id="n37361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchantress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorceress</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 99</bibl> (v. Ritschl ad h. l.); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecanus: <entryFree id="n37362" type="hapax" key="praeca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gray before one's time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis exigui, praecanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 24</bibl></cit> (ante tempus canum, Schol. Cruqu.).</sense></entryFree>
praecarpo: <entryFree id="n37363" type="main" key="praecarpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-carpo</orth>, v. praecerpo.</entryFree>
praecatechizatus: <entryFree id="n37364" type="main" key="praeca^te_chi_za_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cătēchīzātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [catechizo], <sense id="n37364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">previously instructed</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecatechizatus a prophetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Interpr. Iren. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecautio: <entryFree id="n37365" type="main" key="praecauti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecautĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecaveo</etym>, <sense id="n37365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">precaution</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">passionis avertendae praecautio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecautus: <entryFree id="n37366" type="main" key="praecautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praecaveo.</entryFree>
praecaveo: <entryFree id="n37367" type="main" key="praeca^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-căvĕo</orth>, <itype>cāvi, cautum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n37367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to guard against beforehand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37367.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to guard against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to avert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obviate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. provideo): illud praecavendum est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata, quae difficillime praecaventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod a me ita praecautum atque ita provisum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi res tota provisa atque praecauta est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:41" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malam diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37367.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to use precaution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be on one's guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beware</hi> (class.): ferae, quibus abest ad praecavendum intellegendi astutia, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 103 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentem ante et praecaventem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecaventibus fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab insidiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to guard against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ne accideret, magnopere sibi praecavendum Caesar existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis undique provisum atque praecautum est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videtur praecaveri potuisse, si provisum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 99</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to provide for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take precautions for one's safety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed praecauto'st opus, ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>there is need of caution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecedo: <entryFree id="n37368" type="main" key="praece_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n37368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi> (seems not to occur in Cic., Nep., Tac., or Sall.; once in Cæs.; syn.: antecedo, anteverto). </sense><sense id="n37368.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n37368.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> <cb n="PRAE" /> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is praecedens agmen militum ad tribunal pergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoriā nave praecedente classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 26, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 41, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus armenta praecedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 3, 16, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias fax cereusque praecessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum nostrum aut praecedentes aut sequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">at quae venturas praecedet sexta Calendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:705" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 705</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37368.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstrip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outdo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior to</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii reliquos Gallos virtute praecedunt,</quote> <trans><tr>excel in bravery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vestros honores rebis gerendis praecessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 51, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteras omnis sapore praecedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baetica cunctas provinciarum divite cultu praecedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo praecessit omnes D. Silanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sapientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37368.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead the way</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37368.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus esse et ipsos praecedere ad confirmandam civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equite, ut prius venisse quam venturum sciant, praecedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecedebat ipse vinctus, sequebatur grex, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 39, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 59, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem ex Paeoniā praecedere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:13" default="NO">3, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:5" default="NO">5, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi maria tranant capita imponentes praecedentium clunibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37368.6" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">fama loquax praecessit ad aures, Deïanira, tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:614" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 614</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Plin 31, 6, 33, § 64: nullā praecedente injuriā,</quote> <trans><tr>without previous injury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37368.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be older</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem et octo annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37368.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel;</hi> with the <case>dat.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut vostrae fortunae meis praecedunt longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeceler: <entryFree id="n37369" type="main" key="praece^ler"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cĕler</orth>, <itype>cĕlĕris, e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very swift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quick</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">viri cursu praeceleres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:550" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 46, 70, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecelero: <entryFree id="n37370" type="main" key="praece^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cĕlĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n37370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hasten before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n37370.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:798" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 798</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37370.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calle latenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:497" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 497</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecellens: <entryFree id="n37371" type="main" key="praecellens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cellens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praecello.</entryFree>
praecellentia: <entryFree id="n37372" type="main" key="praecellenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecellentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecellens</etym>, <sense id="n37372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excellence</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecellentia divinitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecelleo: <entryFree id="n37373" type="main" key="praecelle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecellĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. praecello <sense id="n37373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecello: <entryFree id="n37374" type="main" key="praecello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cello</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (collat. form, acc. to the 2d conj.; <sense id="n37374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> praecellet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; perh. originally written praecellit), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">to rise above</hi> others. </sense><sense id="n37374.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi> any one (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. antecello): praecellere aliquam fecunditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37374.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37374.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To distinguish one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excel</hi> (syn. excello): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque fortunā utitur, Ita praecellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecellere mobilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odore et suavitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 21, 23, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitate inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecellere per insignem nobilitatem et eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37374.4" n="B" level="2"> Alicui. </sense><sense id="n37374.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be superior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:74" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37374.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To preside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rule over</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">genti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cellens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">surpassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37374.7" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">vir et animo et virtute praecellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir omnibus rebus praecellentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37374.8" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones magnitudine praecellentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā praecellente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingenii praecellentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor pomo et suavitate praecellentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 6, 12, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecelsus: <entryFree id="n37375" type="main" key="praecelsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-celsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very high</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi> (class.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.; cf.: arduus, sublimis, excelsus). </sense><sense id="n37375.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 15, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37375.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 85</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fid. 4, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Luc. 3, 3, 37</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl>, perexcelso, B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
praecentio: <entryFree id="n37376" type="main" key="praecenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecino</etym>, <sense id="n37376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">playing before</hi> a sacrifice, a battle, etc., <hi rend="ital">a prelude</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tran quilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1412" /> <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praecento: <entryFree id="n37377" type="main" key="praecento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>prae-canto</etym>, <sense id="n37377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer consolation in song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic Epicurus praecentet, si potest, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit> B. and K.; v. Madv. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
praecentor: <entryFree id="n37378" type="main" key="praecentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praecino</etym>, <sense id="n37378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader</hi> in music, <hi rend="ital">precentor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecentor in choris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 74, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecentor qui vocem praemittit (opp. succentor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 87" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 12, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecentorius: <entryFree id="n37379" type="main" key="praecento_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecentōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praecentor</etym>, <sense id="n37379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a prelude</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">harundines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeceps: <entryFree id="n37380" type="main" key="praeceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭ-pes</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; id. et Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 725</bibl> P.
