(Ann. v. 391 Vahl.; <case>abl.</case> praecipiti), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prae-caput</etym>. <sense id="n37380.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">headforemost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headlong</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem trahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praecipitem deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps ad terram datus,</quote> <trans><tr>dashed to the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps curru ab alto Desilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se praecipitem tecto dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>threw himself headlong from the roof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in praeceps jacere,</quote> <trans><tr>headlong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jacto in praeceps corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in praeceps deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—For in praeceps, in late Lat., per praeceps occurs: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit grex per praeceps in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Judic. 5, 22</bibl>.—Hence, of one going rapidly, <hi rend="ital">headforemost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headlong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ponte Ire praecipitem in lutum per caputque pedesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jacere praecipitem e vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 860</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab equo praeceps decidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:259" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) praecipites Cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praecipitem agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive headlong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 456</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites se fugae mandabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Monoeten In mare praecipitem deturbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 175</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps amensque cucurri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 844</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps Fertur,</quote> <trans><tr>is borne headlong</tr>, <tr>rushes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things. </sense><sense id="n37380.2" n="1" level="3"> Of localities, qs. that descend suddenly in front, i. e. <hi rend="ital">downhill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in declivi ac praecipiti loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via (opp. plana),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 42, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:888" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 888</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: iter ad malum praeceps ac lubricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:16" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a steep place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precipice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim in praecipiti stantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus vasto in praeceps hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praeceps pervenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praecipitia cursus iste deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in vitibus) praecipites palmites dicuntur, qui de hornotinis virgis enati in duro alligantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol Praecipitem lavit aequore currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam praeceps in occasum sol erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37380.5" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: celer, velox): praeceps Anio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans><tr>fleeting</tr>, <tr>transient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:485" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:419" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceani fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:404" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 262" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">headlong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37380.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">noster erus, qui scelestus sacerdotem anum praecipes Reppulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol jam praecipitans me quoque haec praecipitem paene evolvere coëgit,</quote> <trans><tr>almost headlong</tr>, <tr>precipitately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agunt eum praecipitem poenae civium Romanorum,</quote> <trans><tr>chase</tr>, <tr>pursue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem amicum ferri sinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to rush into the abyss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ab inimicis praeceps agor,</quote> <trans><tr>am pursued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps celeritas dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: profectio, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl>: occumbunt multi letum ... praecipe cursu, <hi rend="ital">in rapid destruction</hi>, Enn. l. l.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SI NON FATORVM PRAECEPS HIC MORTIS OBISSET,</quote> <trans><tr>sudden as regards fate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 695, 9</bibl></cit>, emended by Minervini in Bullet. Arch. Napol. III. 1845, p. 41 (but Minervini's assumption of a new <pos>adj.</pos>, praeceps, from praecipio, <hi rend="ital">anticipating fale</hi>, is unnecessary).—</sense><sense id="n37380.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37380.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in omnibus consiliis praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PRAE" /> praeceps et effrenata mens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps consilium et immaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps in avaritiam et crudelitatem animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps ingenio in iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ad flagitia praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dangerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hazardous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">critical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam praecipiti tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:400" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 400</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37380.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37380.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Great danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">critical circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se et prope rem publicam in praeceps dederat,</quote> <trans><tr>brought into extreme danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare Aegrum ex praecipiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger est in praecipiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The highest part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublimity</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">omne in praecipiti vitium stetit,</quote> <trans><tr>at its point of culmination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debet orator erigi, attolli, efferri, ac saepe accedere ad praeceps,</quote> <trans><tr>to verge on the sublime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ceps</orth>, <hi rend="ital">headlong.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37380.15" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praeceps trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his fulgoribus quaedam praeceps eunt, similia prosilientibus stellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles convulsa dum ruit intus immensam vim mortalium praeceps trahit atque operit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto praeceps se corpore ad undas Misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37380.16" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversio rei familiaris dignitatem ac famam praeceps dabat,</quote> <trans><tr>brought into danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps in exsilium acti,</quote> <trans><tr>suddenly</tr>, <tr>hastily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeceptio: <entryFree id="n37381" type="main" key="praecepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecipio</etym>. <sense id="n37381.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a receiving in advance</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">per praeceptionem legamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Reg. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per praeceptionem legare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:192" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:216" default="NO">216</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37381.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The right of receiving in advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptionem quadringentorum milium dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37381.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A previous notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preconception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam praeceptionem accedere, quam inchoatam habebunt in animis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 36, 123</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37381.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injunction</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex est recti praeceptio, pravique depulsio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in juris scientiā est persecutionum cautionumque praeceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37381.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an imperial rescript</hi> or <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 59, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeceptive: <entryFree id="n37382" type="main" key="praecepti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praeceptivus <sense id="n37382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praeceptivus: <entryFree id="n37383" type="main" key="praecepti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praecipio</etym>, <sense id="n37383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">preceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">didactic</hi> (post-Aug.): pars philosophiae, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">parainetikh/n</foreign> vocant, nos praeceptivam dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portemus praeceptivo modo dicens,</quote> <trans><tr>in the preceptive</tr>, <tr>hortatory mode</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Vid. 12, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Luc. 6, 90</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">preceptively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">didactically</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">portemus inquit, non portabimus, praeceptive, non promissive,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecepto: <entryFree id="n37384" type="gloss" key="praecepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecepto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prescribe often</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptat, in Saliari carmine est saepe praecipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praeceptor: <entryFree id="n37385" type="main" key="praeceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n37385.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who seizes beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an anticipator</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">servilium praeceptor operum (al. praereptor, al. praecerptor),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 23</bibl></cit>, n. 4.—</sense><sense id="n37385.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37385.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceptor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptor tuus, qui te hanc fallaciam docuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendi atque dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptor et auctor omnium consiliorum totiusque vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti bonique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeceptori verborum regula constet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:230" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 230</bibl></cit>.—Of Christ: <cit><quote lang="la">Jesu praeceptor, miserere nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:17:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 17, 13 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri praeceptores putant,</quote> <trans><tr>our authorities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:219" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:87" default="NO">3, 87</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
praeceptorius: <entryFree id="n37386" type="main" key="praecepto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praecursorius.</entryFree>
praeceptrix: <entryFree id="n37387" type="main" key="praeceptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeceptor</etym>, <sense id="n37387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preceptress</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiā praeceptrice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptrix et magistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeceptum: <entryFree id="n37388" type="main" key="praeceptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praecipio <sense id="n37388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praeceptus: <entryFree id="n37389" type="main" key="praeceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praecipio.</entryFree>
praecerpo: <entryFree id="n37390" type="main" key="praecerpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cerpo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">praecarpo</orth>, Oppius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>), <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>carpo</etym>. <cb n="PRAE" /> <sense id="n37390.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break off</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gather before</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">before the time</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germinum tenera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl></cit>: mala citrea (opp. maturescere), Oppius ap. Macr. l. l. —</sense><sense id="n37390.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck beforehand;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non praecerpo fructum officii tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurae decus praecerptum praefloratumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam novitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n37390.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck out in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:193" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 193</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n37390.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make extracts from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristotelis libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 30, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecerptus: <entryFree id="n37391" type="main" key="praecerptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecerptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praecerpo.</entryFree>
praecertatio: <entryFree id="n37392" type="spur" key="praecerta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-certātĭo</orth>, a false read. for par certatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl>.</entryFree>
praecessor: <entryFree id="n37393" type="main" key="praecessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praecedo</etym>. <sense id="n37393.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A predecessor</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3</bibl>, n. 20.—</sense><sense id="n37393.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A superior in rank</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecia: <entryFree id="n37394" type="main" key="praeci^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prae-cieo</etym>, <sense id="n37394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public crier</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herald</hi> who preceded the flamen and bade the artisans leave off their work for a while, in order not to desecrate the solemnities, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 28</bibl> (acc. to conject.; <cit><quote lang="la">codd. plerique).—They were also called praeciamitatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl></cit> Müll. (acc. to Müller, observation on praecia, p. 224, a, praeciamitatores is perhaps corrupted from praeciaminatores, which is formed from praeciaminare, a lengthened form for praeciare, from praecia; but the word was more probably corrupted at an early period from praeclamitatores).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n37395" type="main" key="praeci^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭa</orth>, v. preciae.</entryFree>
praecianus: <entryFree id="n37396" type="main" key="Praeci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Praecĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <sense id="n37396.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated kind of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 60</bibl></cit> (Praetetianus, Jahn): <cit><quote lang="la">Praecianum pirum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecidaneus: <entryFree id="n37397" type="main" key="praeci_da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praecaedo</etym>. <sense id="n37397.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that is slaughtered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacrificed before</hi> (ante and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">porca praecidanea,</quote> <trans><tr>the preliminary sacrifice of a sow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl></cit>: quod humatus non sit, heredi porca praecidanea suscipienda Telluri et Cereri: aliter familia pura non est, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecidaneae hostiae dicuntur, quae ante sacrificia sollemnia pridie caeduntur. Porca etiam praecidanea appellata, quam piaculi gratiā, ante fruges novas fieri coeptas immolari Cereri mos fuit, si qui familiam funestam aut non purgaverant, aut aliter eam rem, quam oportuerat, procuraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: praecidanea agna vocabatur, quae ante alias caedebatur. Item porca quae Cereri mactabatur ab eo, qui mortuo justa non fecisset, id est glebam non objecisset, quia mos erat eis id facere, priusquam novas fruges gustarent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n37397.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: feriae praecidaneae, <hi rend="ital">a preliminary festival</hi>, Atei. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecidarius: <entryFree id="n37398" type="hapax" key="praeci_da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for praecidaneus, Mar. Vict. p. 2470 P.</entryFree>
praecido: <entryFree id="n37399" type="main" key="praeci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cīdo</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecaedit</orth>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 18</bibl>), <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n37399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off in front;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to cut off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.); constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone, or with <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen. of person.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37399.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum alicui gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures, nasum et labia alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegae sui praecidi caput jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae patrem occiderit, manus ejus praecidantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 9:27:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 9, 27, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:44" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput, Quadrig. ap. Gell. l. l.: capita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medici membra praecidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 8:3:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancoras,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut the cables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulas, quibus aqua suppeditatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37399.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cotem novaculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam Nicanoris praecisam jussit particulatim avibus dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to cripple</tr>, <tr>make unfit for service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To beat to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to batter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smash</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecide os tu illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit> (dub.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 12</bibl> Ritschl).—</sense><sense id="n37399.8" n="3" level="3"> Praecidere sinum maris, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to sail straight</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 1</bibl>: medium mare, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 22</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1413" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> § 83.—</sense><sense id="n37399.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37399.10" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to cut short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge; to cut short one's words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">finish abruptly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum te obtuetur, interim linguam oculi praeciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam partem defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:62:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 62, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi licentiam libertatemque vivendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">3: sibi reditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per abscissionem significatio fit, si, cum incipimus aliquid dicere, praecidimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi praecidam,</quote> <trans><tr>in a word</tr>, <tr>in short</tr>, <tr>briefly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecide, inquit,</quote> <trans><tr>cut it short</tr>, <tr>be brief</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy;</hi> esp. with <hi rend="ital">spem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non praeciditur spes plebeio quoque, apiscendi summi honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecisa consulatūs spes erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 50, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id sum assecutus, ut una hora perdito spem judicii corrumpendi praeciderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum spem nostram praecidat an differat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:28:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 5, 1</bibl>.—Also of friendship, etc.: amicitias repente praecidere, <hi rend="ital">to break off suddenly</hi> (opp. sensim dissuere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deny flatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">plane sine ullā exceptione praecidit,</quote> <trans><tr>flatly refused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiebam eum esse nobiscum: quod quia praeciderat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37399.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torn off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Trinacria Italiā praecisa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 630</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecī-sum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a piece of meat cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steak</hi> (ante-class.), Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 2</bibl>: praeciso capi, Lucil. ib.—</sense><sense id="n37399.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37399.15" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Castrated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fanatici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecisi ac professi impudientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Broken off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">acuta silex praecisis undique saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37399.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Shortened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecisis conclusionibus obscuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Troublesome</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut sub obtentu militiae praecisiorem se adversario faceret (al. pretiosiorem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cīsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n37399.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in few words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecise dicere (opp. plene et perfecte dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37399.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Positively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolutely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecise negare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praecise, sed sub condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecinctio: <entryFree id="n37400" type="main" key="praecincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecingo</etym>, lit., <sense id="n37400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girding about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi>: zonae, Hilar. in Matt. 2, 2.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37400.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the broad landing-place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lobby around the amphitheatre</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">between each tier of seats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecinctorium: <entryFree id="n37401" type="main" key="praecincto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecinctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apron</hi> (eccl. Lat.): fecerunt praecinctoria de foliis fici, Aug. Genes. cont. Manich. 2, 2.</sense></entryFree>
praecinctura: <entryFree id="n37402" type="main" key="praecinctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecinctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girdle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 21</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecinctus: <entryFree id="n37403" type="main" key="praecinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praecingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37404" type="main" key="praecinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praecingo</etym>, <sense id="n37404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37404.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class.): castula est palliolum praecinctui, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 548, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37404.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a dressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in praecinctu ponens omnem decorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecingo: <entryFree id="n37405" type="main" key="praecingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cingo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gird about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gird.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cincticulo praecinctus in sellā aput magistrum adsidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">det tunicam locuples: ego te praecingere possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:153:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 153, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia cultro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 341</bibl></cit>.—More freq. mid.: praecingi, <hi rend="ital">to gird one's self</hi>: cum strophio accurate praecingerere, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et latro et cautus praecingitur ense viator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:271" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecincti recte pueri,</quote> <trans><tr>properly girded</tr>, <tr>girded up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut male praecinctum puerum caverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: nox mediis signis praecincta volabit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 416 Vahl.): iter ... altius ac nos Praecinctis unum, <hi rend="ital">to those more girded up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to more rapid travellers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37405.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi> with any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fontem vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 7; so, <cit><quote lang="la">litora muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:243" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 243</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: Brundisium praecinctum pulcro portu, Enn. ap. <cb n="PRAE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 478 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemma per transversum lineā albā mediā praecingitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 27, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus praecincta circumfluo mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 66, 66, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecingitur gens mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes testaceo opere praecincti,</quote> <trans><tr>covered</tr>, <tr>overlaid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecino: <entryFree id="n37406" type="main" key="praeci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cĭno</orth>, <itype>cĭnŭi</itype> (e. g. praecinuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 54</bibl>), <itype>centum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cano]. </sense><sense id="n37406.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">play before</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et deorum pulvinaribus et epulis magistratuum fides praecinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecinere sibi tibias jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecinente citharā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubā praecinente,</quote> <trans><tr>sounding beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:16:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37406.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to utter an incantation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine cum magico praecinuisset anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37406.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitum,</quote> <trans><tr>a funeral song</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:59" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37406.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum aliquid deos populo Romano praemonstrare et praecinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos praecinuisse fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:74" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphati futura praecinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 46, 71, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum sideris,</quote> <trans><tr>foretell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give responses respecting the future</tr>, <tr>to utter predictions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecipes: <entryFree id="n37407" type="main" key="praeci^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpes</orth>, <itype>pis</itype>, v. praeceps <sense id="n37407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecipiens: <entryFree id="n37408" type="main" key="praeci^pi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n37408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. praecipio.</sense></entryFree>
praecipio: <entryFree id="n37409" type="main" key="praeci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, <sense id="n37409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seize beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive in advance</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: anticipo, praeoccupo). </sense><sense id="n37409.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37409.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1050" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1050</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi aquam praecepimus ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a publicanis pecuniam insequentis anni mutuam praeceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum viae,</quote> <trans><tr>to get the start somewhat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius spatium fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piraeeum quinqueremibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to preoccupy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: mons a Lusitanis praeceptus, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lac praeceperit aestus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have previously dried up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37409.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in jurid. lang, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi> (esp. an inheritance or bequest) <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si heres centum praecipere jussus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:122" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 122</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:63" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 36, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantitatem dotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:81" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:46" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per praeceptionem hoc modo legamus: Lucius Titius hominem Stichum praecipito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:216" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 216</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37409.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37409.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obtain in advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum ad fugam temporis Syphax et Hasdrubal praeceperunt,</quote> <trans><tr>gained some advantage in time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres neu praecipe Parcas,</quote> <trans><tr>do not hasten in advance of</tr>, <tr>do not anticipate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:328" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 328</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">veneno fata praecepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: praecipio gaudia suppliciorum vestrorum, <hi rend="ital">I rejoice in advance</hi>, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam animo victoriam praecipiebant,</quote> <trans><tr>figured to themselves beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe jam praecipit hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 491</bibl></cit>: praecipere cogitatione futura, <hi rend="ital">to conjecture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imagine beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec usu ventura opinione praeceperat,</quote> <trans><tr>had already suspected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed alterum mihi est certius, nec praecipiam tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37409.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to give rules</hi> or <hi rend="ital">precepts to</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to advise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admonish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teach; to enjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">mando, impero, doceo): vilici officia, quae dominus praecepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philocomasio id praecipiendum est, ut sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi numquam unam rem me licet semel praecipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ego tibi praecipio, ea facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docui, monui, bene praecepi semper quae potui omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid praecipies, esto brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de agriculturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui aliquid praecipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: glossemata nobis, Asin. Gall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerumque modumque carinis Praecipiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus lugubres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem nandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:486" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mitem animum et mores modicis erroribus aequos Praecipit,</quote> <trans><tr>enjoins</tr>, <tr>recommends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia praecipit, parcere omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PRAE" /> 12, 21; so, <cit><quote lang="la">paeoniam praecipiunt eruere noctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicillos aperiri testator praecepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:89" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 89</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud potius praecipiendum fuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte etiam praecipi potest in amicitiis, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulentibus Pythia praecepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipit atque interdicit, omnes unum peterent Indutiomarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his praecepit, omnes mortales pecuniā aggrediantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam scelere convictos nonnisi ad opus damnari praeceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">D. Claudius edicto praecepit,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed</tr>, <tr>commanded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 15</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a teacher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam prope consummata fuerit praecipientis opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in numero praecipientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">a maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precept; an order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bidding; an injunction</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo praecepto ab iis diligentissime observato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine praecepto ullius suā sponte struebatur acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvectae praecepto ducis alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praeceptum patet latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praeceptum officii diligenter tenendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis monitis praeceptisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam (partem) praecepta nobis danda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:17:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 17, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundare praeceptis philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare praecepta dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 273</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">studiosis dicendi praecepta tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm praecepta secuti,</quote> <trans><tr>orders</tr>, <tr>commands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine vi non ulla dabit (Nereus) praecepta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 398</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecipitanter: <entryFree id="n37410" type="main" key="praeci^pi^tanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭtanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praecipito <sense id="n37410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecipitantia: <entryFree id="n37411" type="main" key="praeci^pi^tanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭtantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecipito</etym>, <sense id="n37411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling headlong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rapid fall</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:5" default="NO">9, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecipitatio: <entryFree id="n37412" type="main" key="praeci^pi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling headlong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headlong hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate haste</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 12, 6</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 61, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 51, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecipitator: <entryFree id="n37413" type="main" key="praeci^pi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrower</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Duas Epp. Pelag. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
praecipitium: <entryFree id="n37414" type="main" key="praeci^pi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praecipito</etym>. <sense id="n37414.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a steep place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an abrupt descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precipice</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in praecipitium propellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 7, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37414.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut per confragosa vexabitur aut per praecipitia labetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:41:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 41, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37414.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a falling headlong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a falling down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum aliorum praecipitium vident,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herba urceolaris) contra, lapsus et praecipitia singularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecipito: <entryFree id="n37415" type="main" key="praeci^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praeceps</etym>, <sense id="n37415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast down headlong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to precipitate</hi> (class.; syn.. deicio, deturbo, proruo). </sense><sense id="n37415.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37415.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae in mare praecipitatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncas rupes in tecta domosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:881" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 881</bibl></cit>: currum scopulis, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 518</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 546</bibl></cit>.— Freq. with <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> in middle sense: <cit><quote lang="la">se e Leucade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de turri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese in fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitasse se quosdam constabat (sc. de muro),</quote> <trans><tr>threw themselves from the wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 277</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique semet ipsi praecipitaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in Tiberim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:32" default="NO">6, 6, 32</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 18: ubi Nilus praecipitans se fragore auditum accolis aufert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitare volens etiam pulcherrima,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw overboard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 38</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii super vallum praecipitarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>threw themselves down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:164" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 760</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 556</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux Praecipitatur aquis,</quote> <trans><tr>sinks in the ocean</tr>, <tr>sets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hac te praecipitato,</quote> <trans><tr>run this way</tr>, <tr>for life!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: si quando iis (parvis) ludentes minamur, praecipitaturos alicunde, extimescunt, <hi rend="ital">that we will throw them down from any place</hi> (= nos eos dejecturos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37415.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37415.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37415.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cast down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to precipitate</hi>: <pb n="1414" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> praecipitari ex altissimo dignitatis gradu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:37:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 37, 98</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanta mala praeeipitatus ex patrio regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 23</bibl></cit>.— Esp. with <hi rend="ital">reflex. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet ipse praecipitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten to ruin</tr>, <tr>destroy one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in exitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18, 7</bibl></cit> dub. (Madv. omits se): <cit><quote lang="la">furor iraque mentem Praecipitant,</quote> <trans><tr>carry away</tr>, <tr>urge onward</tr>, <tr>sway violently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem festinando praecipitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senectam praecipitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause to grow old prematurely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam praecipitat subjecta potentia magnae Invidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 56</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl>: nox praecipitata, <hi rend="ital">declining</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">drawing to a close</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 47</bibl>; cf.: aetas praecipitata (opp. adulescens), <hi rend="ital">declining age</hi>, Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37415.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi> a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quae Praecipitent obitum,</quote> <trans><tr>hasten their setting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=349" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:166" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne praecipitetur editio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia raptim praecipitata,</quote> <trans><tr>precipitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exchange delay for haste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 443</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 699</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiphyn pelago parari praecipitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:390" default="NO"><author>Val.
