Fl.</author> 2, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37415.7" n="3" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi> to do any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dare tempus Praecipitant curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si praecipitant miserum cognoscere curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:679" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 679</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37415.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rush down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw one's self down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush headlong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> (class., but only of involuntary falling; cf. I. A.). </sense><sense id="n37415.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitare istuc quidem est, non descendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de montibus altis ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1021" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1021</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Nilus praecipitat ex altissimis montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fibrenus ... statim praecipitat in Lirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: and: <cit><quote lang="la">in amni praecipitante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi In vada praecipitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 670</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 2, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">39, 2, 3: in insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fugis hinc praeceps, dum praecipitare potestas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol praecipitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nox caelo Praecipitat,</quote> <trans><tr>is sinking</tr>, <tr>draws to a close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems jam praecipitaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>had closed</tr>, <tr>come to an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37415.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37415.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sink to ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in amorem Praecipitavit, pejus perit quam si saxo saliat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitantes impellere, certe est inhumanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitantem impellamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi non subest, quo praecipitet ac decidat,</quote> <trans><tr>he may tumble down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitante re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 87</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad Cannas praecipitasset Romana res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exitium praecipitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37415.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be too hasty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vitiosum sit adsentiri quicquam aut falsum aut incognitum, sustinenda est potius omnis adsensio, ne praecipitet, si temere processerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpĭ-tanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agens mannos ad villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1063</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
